b801079396.gt:
In a small pot simmer the green garlic in the olive oil for 5 minutes.
Cool completely (this is very important, if the oil is still warm, the aioli will break).
When the oil is cold, combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl and whisk until frothy.
Slowly drizzle the green garlic olive oil in drop by drop until an emulsion is made.
Continue to add the oil and green garlic until you aioli is thick and creamy, season with salt to taste.
b801079396.pred:
put the green garlic in a large saute pan with a little oil. roast over medium high heat, tossing occasionally, until tender and golden brown, about 20 minutes.

 in comal, heat about 1/2 cup olive oil and add the grated red onion. roast until the onions are a dark golden brown in color, about 12 15 minutes. let cool and crumble into small bits.
 in the meantime, in resealable container, mix the mayo, mustard, vinegar, lemon zest, and herbs.
 when the greens are finished, mix them into the mayonnaise and season with salt to taste. add more lemon juice if you think you need more. spoon the aoli on top of the toasted pecorono and serve at room temperature.

0935eaa489.gt:
Microwave chocolate in microwaveable bowl on MEDIUM 2 min.
or until chocolate is almost melted, stirring after 1 min.
Stir until chocolate is completely melted.
Stir in 3/4 cup each of the grahams and marshmallows.
Spread onto waxed paper-covered baking sheet.
Decorate with remaining grahams and marshmallows.
Refrigerate 1 hour or until firm.
Break into 60 pieces.
0935eaa489.pred:
the idea is to make the cookies be the same in size as the cookies.
 if you bake your cookies on the baking sheet, let them set overnight at room temperature in a very warm place.
 you may wish to put them in the refrigerator for about 10 minutes so they can firm up a little.
 take the cookies from the refrigerator and peel off the parchment paper.
 split each cookie in half crosswise and place one half flat side down on a sheet pan.
 cover each half of cookie with half of the crushed cookies.
 if you are making a full batch, you may have to put these pieces back into the refrigerator to chill well.
 place a heaping 1/2 cup of the sweetened condensed milk, the marshmallows and the peanut butter cups, the remaining crushed cookies and the chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl.
 heat in 30 second intervals, stirring, until the marshmallows have melted.
 remove from the microwave and stir to blend.
 if the mixture seems to be too thick, return to the microwave and cook, stirring, until the chocolate is melted.
 spoon the chocolate mixture into the cookies and smooth the tops with a spatula.
 cover and refrigerate until firm.
 store the cookies in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two days.
 reheat them in the microwave, if necessary.

35f4aac182.gt:
Place rice into the bento, cover the whole surface with bonito flakes, and drizzle with a round of soy sauce.
Top it with shredded nori seaweed and roasted sesame.
The crackly texture and aroma of the baked seaweed is delicious.
Cover with lots of kettle-cooked shirasu.
Shred shiso leaves and scatter.
It smells great.
Top it with ginger to taste .
Grate a daikon radish, lightly squeezing out the excess water, mix with ponzu sauce in a small container to make grated ponzu sauce.
It tastes great to eat this with the grated ponzu sauce from Step 5.
In addition to the bento: Misakiko fried tuna katsu, Kanagawa komatsuna and daikon radish, aburaage stir-fry, Odawara fish paste with shiso leaves and pickled plums, imitation crab meat fried eggs, and tomatoes and shiso leaves.
Try eating the fried tuna katsu with lots of grated daikon and ponzu sauce from Step 5 ..

660f4fdb1a.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degree F. Grease a 13x9x2-inch baking pan; set aside.
In a medium mixing bowl beat cream cheese with an electric mixer until fluffy.
Beat in 1/4 cup sugar; fold in lemon yogurt and lemon peel.
Set aside.
In a large mixing bowl stir together 3 cups flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, salt and nutmeg or mace.
Cut in the 1 cup butter until mixture resembles fine crumbs.
Combine eggs, milk and almond extract.
Add to flour mixture, mixing until blended.
Spread half of the batter in the prepared pan.
Spoon the cream cheese mixture over the batter.
Spoon the remaining batter in small mounds over the cream cheese mixture, spreading out as much as possible.
Combine the 1/2 cup sugar and 1/2 cup flour; cut in the 1/4 cup butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in pecans or almonds.
Sprinkle nut mixture over batter in pan.
Bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until cake is golden andtoothpick inserted in dough mounds comes out clean (do not test in filling).
Cool on wire rack at least 45 minutes before serving.
Chill to store.
660f4fdb1a.pred:
preheat oven to 350 f 180 c and butter and flour an 11x7 inch baking dish or 2 8x8 inch metal baking pans.
 in a mixing bowl beat together the cream cheese and softened butter until smooth and well blended. add in the granualty flavored cream and mix to combine well and then beat in the heavy cream. add the lemon yogurt and lemon peel. beat until creamy and spread evenly in the pan.
 to prepare the topping in oblong bowl, combine all

412174e62b.gt:
Preheat your waffle iron to high.
In a bowl, mix together waffle ingredients.
Pour batter into your heated waffle iron and cook according to your waffle iron instructions, probably around 2-3 minutes or until it reaches your desired crispness.
Repeat with the remaining batter.
Meanwhile, heat a small skillet over medium heat and add sliced apple and water.
Let simmer 2-3 minutes, or until apples begin to get tender.
Stir in remaining topping ingredients (except the walnuts) and let simmer for another 2-3 minutes, or until apples are completely tender.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Top waffles with apple mixture and sprinkle with toasted walnuts.
Enjoy!
*To toast walnuts, place in skillet over medium heat and cook until fragrant and nutty!
412174e62b.pred:
preheat oven to 350 f.
 in med size bowl combine cake mix and pudding mix, satsuma, egg, almonds, honey, sweetener, evaporated milk, yogurt, flax, vanilla, salt, and cinnamon. mix well.
 fold in sliced apples. pour into greased and floured 9x9 baking dish.
 bake until golden brown and toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. about 50 minutes. cool.
 meanwhile to prepare apples, combine apples, peele and slice apples, tucson syrup, water, applesauce, aganese, apples, cinnamon, stewri, 1 c water, and 2 t applesauces in blender and blend until very smooth.
 pour applesauc over pie and bake 10 minutes more. remove from oven and allow to cool. when cool, pour syrup over pie, making sure to cover entire pie and letting it be coated in syrup. sprinkle the

31f21b4147.gt:
In a large saucepan, mix all ingredients together.
On medium heat, bring mixture to a boil.
Continue to simmer (on low-medium) heat for one hour, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and allow to cool.
Pour into mason jars and refrigerate for 12-24 hours before serving.
Enjoy cold!
31f21b4147.pred:
combine all ingredients except the garnish in a medium saucepan.
 add the garnish and stir well.
 cook on medium low heat for 15 to 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mixture thickens slightly.
 remove from the heat and let the mixture cool to room temperature before serving.

646d990717.gt:
Cut the chicken breast into thin slices.
Soak dried shiitake mushrooms in lukewarm water until soft.
Cut off hard stems and cut in halves.
Cut onion into thin slices.
Chop cilantro.
In a large skillet with a lid, mix all the simmering sauce ingredients and bring to a boil.
Add chicken, mushrooms and onion and cook over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes, or until chicken is done and onion is tender.
Beat eggs in a small bowl, then pour over the chicken and cover with a lid.
Cook until the egg is set, about 1 minute on low heat.
Sprinkle cilantro on top.
To serve: put about 1 1/4 cup of rice in a large, deep bowl and gently lay 1/4 of the chicken and egg mixture on top.
Pour simmering sauce over and serve immediately.

95fc2c99a6.gt:
Combine dry ingredients in large bowl.
Whisk remaining ingredients together; stir into dry mixture just until moistened.
Pour batter by 1/4 cupfuls onto a hot nonstick griddle coated with nonstick cooking spray.
Turn when bubbles form on top of pancakes; cook until second side is golden brown.

2a96229516.gt:
Brown sausage in a skillet over med.
heat.
Drain fat and transfer to crockpot.
Combine remaining ingredients in crockpot.
Cover and cook on low 8 hrs.
or on high 4 hrs.
Remove bay leaves.
Serve over cooked rice.

b6f5004817.gt:
Combine all together, cook on low in crock-pot 6-8 hours.
Serve with brown rice.
b6f5004817.pred:
combine all ingredients.
 set aside for at least 1/2 hour.
 broil tenderlops until chicken is done about 3 5 min. per side.

0c55421a39.gt:
Combine the ingredients in the order listed in a spill proof shaker and shake until thoroughly mixed.
Top wtih whipped cream and grated chocolate, if using.
Serve immediately.
0c55421a39.pred:
assemble iced tea, lime juice, lime zest, and lime juice in a large pitcher. place rum, rum syrup, lemon juice and lime zest in mug and shake. place 1/2 cup of ice in emulsified coulis and pour into mug.
 add crushed tequilles lime wedge, orange peel, and koji dashi powder to the pitcher. add vodka, lime lime juice and juice. stir in sparkling water. add crushed crystallized tahitian rose liqueur or tangelo powder, stirring to blend. spoon some of the tangerine and kiwi into glasses and serve in glasses.
 for toddies
 add 1 1/2 teaspoons of the yellow mustard and 1/8 1/8 tsp. of the green spice to each glass.
 top each glass with 1 tablespoons of half andhalf.
 prepare the sweetened goji berries according to package directions, reserving 1/2 teaspoon of the orange zest. remove ice if desired. top with chocolate, and optionally add the chocolate shavings for garnish. add the 1 ounce of orange zest to each drink.

78bbc2284a.gt:
1.
Place the grapes on a parchment-lined plate in the freezer.
2.
Pour the boiling water over the hibiscus flowers, cover and allow to steep 15-20 minutes.
Whisk in the sugar until it dissolves.
3.
Pour the red wine and sliced peaches into a small pitcher.
Strain the hibiscus tea over the top, discarding the flowers.
4.
Chill this mixture until ready to serve.
5.
Stir in the frozen grapes, and enjoy while watching the sunset.
78bbc2284a.pred:
puree the grapes in a blender until smooth.
 combine the chopped nuts, crushed nuts, water, crushed peppercorn in drained grape puree.
 pour the liquid into a large saucepan.
 bring to a boil.
 add the crushed dried fruit along with the butternut pieces, fig slices if using and dried fig leaves.
 allow the mixture to boil gently, stirring frequently, for about 3 to 4 minutes.
 then remove from the heat.
 stir in the chopped hazel nuts and the chopped prunes.
 set aside to cool.
 remove the grapefruit mixture from the saucepan and stir in 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract and 1/2 teaspoon teaspoon of chopped nutmeg.
 transfer to jars or containers.
 cover tightly and refrigerate for up to 1 month.
 makes 2 1/2 quarts.

eef728c6b8.gt:
Lightly coat a nonstick skillet with cooking spray.
Cook the onion and chiles in the skillet over medium heat for 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg substitute, cheese, pepper, and Tabasco (if using).
Pour into skillet and scramble for 3 to 4 minutes, until the eggs are done to taste, but not dry.
Place the egg mixture along one-third of the tortilla, about 2 inches away from the bottom.
Fold up the lower edge, then roll from the side to form a burrito.

de0bb5ab55.gt:
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius or 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
Soak the bread in the milk for 1 minute; squeeze dry.
Combine the bread, sausage meat, raw egg, parsley, nutmeg, salt and pepper.
Mix well.
Lightly oil a 12 cup muffin tray; line each cup with a slice of bacon.
Cover with a layer of sausage mixture; add a hard boiled egg, pointy end up.
Enclose the egg completely with more sausage meat mixture.
Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until cooked through.
de0bb5ab55.pred:
preheat the oven to 350 degrees 175 c. f. spray a 9 x 13 x 2 inch baking dish.
 cut the bread into 1 inch cube pieces and place in a mixing bowl.
 pour in 1 1/2 cans of elk s broth or e.v.o.p. and mix gently.
 in lrg mixing bowl, combine the remaining 8

a96ec50638.gt:
In a large salad bowl, combine the spinach, apples and rasins.
In a small bowl, whisk the sugar, vinegar, oil, garlic salt and celery calt.
Drizzle over salad and toss to coat.
Sprinkle with cashews.
Serve immediately.
a96ec50638.pred:
for dressing, in a medium sized glass measuring cup whisk together sugar, vinegar, oil and garlic salt until sugar is dissolved.
 pour dressing over baby spinach greens and toss to coat.
 gently fold in apples, crasins, cilantro and casheons.
 cover and chill for at least 30 minutes.

45b311a5c9.gt:
Heat oven to 450*.
Grease 6 6oz custard cups.
Beat eggs slightly; beat in flour, milk, and salt.
Beat just until smooth, do not overbeat.
Fill custard cups 1/2 full.
Bake 20 minutes.
Reduce oven temp to 350*.
Bake 20 minutes longer.
Remove from cups.
Serve warm.
45b311a5c9.pred:
in a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs.
 add the flour, milk and salt and stir until the mixture leaves the side of the bowl.
 cover with a towel. let stand for at least 2 hours before using.
 if you don t have time to refrigerate, let it sit out at room temperature for 15 minutes so it gets warm before using.
 place the dough in ice water and stir.
 it should be a bit less soft than a regular pancake batter.
 when you start to get a stiff dough, knead it for a minute, then form into a ball.
 wrap the dough with plastic wrap and place it in ten by ten inch resealable bag.
 leave the bag in the ice bath to stiffen the dough for 10 minutes.
 drain off the water and wash off with water.
 the dough can be cooked in crockpots or a heavy frypan.
 this takes about ten minutes.

3c84706338.gt:
Preheat oven to 400?.
Spray a 2 qt casserole dish, or 9x9 baking pan with non-stick cooking spray.
In this order, layer the chicken, broccoli, 1 1/2 cups cheddar cheese and 2/3 of the bacon-bits in prepared baking dish.
Reserve the remaining cheese and bacon for topping.
Blend the eggs, milk, Bisquik, and 1/8 tsp.
fresh ground pepper until well combined.
Pour evenly over chicken mixture.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Sprinkle remaining cheese and bacon evenly on top.
Let cool 5 minutes before serving.
3c84706338.pred:
preheat oven to 400f

 grease the bottom of a 9 pie plate or quiche pan with the cut up meat/dried tomato.

 crumble bacon, saute it, remove from pan when browned, and set aside.
 prepare cubed tofutti r to your taste. i use the tofuera. if you want a mushier/pumpkin filled quiche, then remove with the toffee.
 then add the cheeses to the pie pan.

 sprinkle evenly with the ham and/or sausage meat.
 bake for 45 minutes. let it rest for at least 15 minutes and enjoy

1bf5668c79.gt:
Brown ground beef and onion powder in a large skillet over medium heat, drain off fat.
Mix together eggs, cream, mayonnaise, garlic powder, pepper and shredded cheddar cheese.
Put browned beef into a 9 inch pie plate, pour remaining ingredients over the beef.
Place in a preheated 350 degree oven and bake for 40-45 minutes.
1bf5668c79.pred:
in a skillet, brown the ground beef, and onion powder.
 drain any fat that is left.
 add the cheese and simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until the cheese is fully melted.
 cool slightly.
 in gratin pan, mix together the veloute, cream, mayonnaise and evoo.
 beat in egg yolks, garlic, sage, salt and pepper.
 combine 1/2 of the meat mixture, one cup shredded cheese and the vegexture in drizzling style.
 preheat the oven to 350 degrees f 175 degrees c.
 roll the meat into 24 1 inch meatballs.
 place in the burger pan in alternating layers.
 sprinkle the remaining cheese on top of each burger.
 bake for 40 minutes, until lightly golden and eggs are completely set.
 this recipe was created by an adobo seasoning blend which was incorporated into the mayonnaisse.
 yields 16 large or 24 small

5410800131.gt:
Fit a large steamer rack inside a large wide pot.
Add enough water to reach within 1/2 inch of bottom of rack.
Bring to a boil.
Pat chicken dry and put, skin side up, in a shallow bowl (that will fit on steamer rack inside pot).
Sprinkle with ginger and steam, covered, over high heat, until chicken is just cooked through, 30 to 35 minutes (replenish water if necessary).
Carefully remove bowl with chicken.
Pour off juices into a glass measure and set aside 1/4 cup (reserve remainder for another use).
Return chicken in bowl to pot and keep warm, covered, off heat.
Heat a wok or large heavy skillet (not nonstick) over high heat until smoking, then drizzle oil down side of wok and swirl to coat.
Reduce heat to medium, then add garlic and stir-fry 15 seconds.
Add chiles and stir-fry 15 seconds.
Add cilantro and stir-fry 1 minute.
Stir in remaining ingredients, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 cup chicken juices and simmer 1 minute.
Transfer to a bowl.
Drizzle some sauce over chicken (include some solids for a spicier sauce); serve the rest on the side.
Season chicken with salt.
5410800131.pred: cut the chicken legs into 3 4 pieces. cut the remaining meat into 3 or 4 pieces and shred the meat with your fingers. combine the chopped poultry, slivered green shaved ginger, sesamized sesam seeds

e02496cb22.gt:
Combine egg and milk.
Then spread flour, cayenne and cheese on a plate.
Season each fillet with salt and pepper.
Dip fillet in egg mixture, then in flour mixture, then in corn flakes.
Place on a baking sheet lightly sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.
Bake at 450F, 10 minutes per 1 inch fillet or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.
e02496cb22.pred:
preheat oven to 350 degrees f. line a 15 1/2x10 1/2x1 inch baking pan with aluminum foil.
 in a medium size bowl, beat egg white until foamy.
 beat in milk, flour, and cayene pepper until smooth.
 toss fish sticks in flour mixture until coated and set aside.
 pour 1/4 cup cheese into shallow dish.
 place cornflakes in another shallow dish and roll fish sticks evenly in cornflakes.
 arrange on prepared pan.
 bake for 20 25 minutes, until golden brown and fish sticks are cooked through.
 serve immediately.

80aeb71b2a.gt:
Heat oil in 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Cook tomatoes and garlic in oil 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes are tender; reduce heat to low.
Stir in chives, basil, sour cream and mayonnaise.
Cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until sauce is hot.
Meanwhile, heat spaetzle as directed on package.
Add hot spaetzle to skillet; toss to coat with sauce.
80aeb71b2a.pred:
preheat oven to 375 degrees.
 in a large skillet, heat olives, tomato, ham, and parmesan over medium heat.
 when tomatoes are heated, add cheese and cloves, and saute 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
 add dashi and cook 2 minutes, or until cheese melts.
 remove from heat, and stir in cilantro and next 3 ingredients.
 toss gently to mix.
 divide spaetzla between 3 small bowls. sprinkle with olive oil.
 garnish with toasted almonds and chopped basil.
 store in jars or covered container in refrigerator.

3a73e25c27.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Crumble the sausage into a saucepan over low heat; cover and cook until sausage is completely browned, stirring every 30 seconds; drain.
Place the bread on a baking sheet with the crust sides down.
Arrange the cooked sausage evenly over both halves of bread.
Top each with tomato slices, red bell pepper strips, mozzarella slices, green olives, and black olives.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, oregano, basil, salt, pepper, onion, and garlic in a bowl.
Drizzle over baked bread halves.
Bake another 5 minutes.
Cut into 2 inch slices to serve.
3a73e25c27.pred:
cut sausage into 1/2 inch thick slices or crumble into small pcs. brown over medium high heat, stirring to crumble. drain well on paper towels, then set aside.
 arrange bread halves on cookie sheet, cut side up, then layer in the following order cheese, sausage, peppers, prosciutto, tomato, olives and pepper strips. bake in preheated 350 f oven for about 10 minutes or until tops are lightly browned.

 in small bowl, combine olive oil, vinegar, oregeno, basil, salt and pepper. stir in red onion and garlic. pour over pizza.
 bake 10 more minutes or till heated through and cheese is melted.

783457d1f6.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F and spray a 9 square pan with baking spray (or coat with butter).
In a medium bowl, stir together flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, and spices.
Set aside.
In a small bowl, combine eggs, buttermilk, and oil.
Add egg mixture all at once to the flour mixture.
Stir just until moistened.
Pour batter into the hot pan and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, until a knife inserted in the middle comes out clean.
783457d1f6.pred:
in a large bowl, combine the flour, cornmea, cocoa, ground spices, brown sugar, baking powder, tumeric, spices and salt.
 in med.
 bowl, whisk together the eggs, yogurt, buttermilk

c6db02633a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Put the ricotta in a fine mesh strainer set over a bowl and let stand 10 minutes to remove the excess liquid.
Transfer the cheese to a bowl and add the eggs, salt and pepper, to taste and the orange zest.
Stir until well combined.
Transfer the mixture to an 8-ounce shallow baking and serving dish and put on a baking sheet.
Bake in the center of the oven until puffed and beginning to brown, about 35 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Serve warm with olives and baguette or your favorite bread and enjoy!
c6db02633a.pred:
preheat oven to 350 degrees.
 in a mixing bowl, whip rucotta and eggs with electric mixer till light and fluffy. add salt and pepper, orange zest and juice and mix thoroughly. fold in kale, olives, and prosciuto. use a 1 oz 1 1/2 cup scoop, or put this dough into a greased mini muffin pan. bake for 20 minutes or until light golden and set.
 remove from oven, sprinkle croatian bread with a little salt and place slices of prosciu. spoon over ritcalcoiato and squeeze on a tablespoon of fresh orange juice on top. return to oven and bake for 15 minutes or so more, till the bread is toasty and wilted and the cheese is melted. serve warm or at room temperature.
 note if preparing croutons, freeze on cookie sheets for up to 6 months. before reheating, place in crockpot. add enough water to cover, and cook on high for 45 minutes. if making ahead, let cool and keep in the refrigerator for upto 2 days.
 recipe adapted from viva peppada.

e993bcfbe8.gt:
Wash the beans.
In a large pot, cover them with cold water.
Soak for 6-8 hours.
Drain into a colander.
In the same pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat, add the onion and garlic, and saute until soft.
Add the beans and water or stock.
Cover and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low, add the rosemary, and simmer 2 hours or until the beans are tender.
Raise heat to high, add the pasta, and cook until al dente.
Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper, garnish with the chopped parsey.
Serve accompanied by grated Parmesan cheese and the optional extra-virgin olive oil.
e993bcfbe8.pred:
cook the pasta in lightly salted boiling water, stirring occasionally, until barely tender to the bite.
 when pasta is done drain it, and then put it in a serving bowl, toss in the veg.
 oil and some salt and pepper, and let cold a few min to infuse the pasta and/orzo.
 place pasta in the middle of the bowl and top with the parsley, fennel seeds, garlic, rosemary, olive oil and parmesean.
 tosl everything together and serve warm.
 serves 4.

33a9be0b60.gt:
Beat cream cheese spread and shredded cheese in small bowl with mixer until well blended.
Add next 3 ingredients; mix well.
Refrigerate 1 hour.
Shape into ball; roll in parsley.
Serve with celery and crackers.
33a9be0b60.pred:
in a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth.
 gradually add the cheese, red pepper, green onions and mustard. mix well.
 add the parsley and celery to the creamed mixture and mix well again.
 form a ball and chill for 3 hours.
 remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes before serving.
 turn the cheese ball onto a serving dish and cut into 6 slices. serve with crackers.

fa63e5df5b.gt:
Preheat the oven to 425.
Season the chicken breast with 1/8 teaspoon each of sea salt and freshly ground pepper.
In a small pan, heat 1 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil over medium high heat.
Add the chicken and cook for 1 minute.
Turn the chicken, reduce the heat, cover and cook for 8 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat and leave covered for 10 minutes, then shred the chicken with 2 forks.
In a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, water, soy sauce, garlic and the remaining sea salt and freshly ground pepper and whisk to combine.
In an 8-inch-square baking dish, combine the shredded chicken, onion, egg noodles, the cheese, broccoli and the sauce and mix thoroughly.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 10 minutes.
Uncover the dish, stir well and bake for 15 minutes, until the noodles are cooked and the sauce has thickened.
Remove from the oven and let sit for 5 minutes before serving.
fa63e5df5b.pred:
1. preheat oven to 400 degrees f.
 2. cut chicken breast into 1 inch cubes. in a large bowl, toss the chicken with 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper and the tango paste.
 3. heat oil in lrg. skillet over high heat. cook chicken until evenly browned, stirring occasionally. remove chicken from pan and set aside. add cream cheese, breaking it up with a wooden spoon until fully melted. stir in tator, flaked almonds, water, chili powder, soy sauce and garlic. cook over medium high heat until mixture is bubbling hot and just begins to brown, stirring often. stir together chopped cashemon, onion, chopped saltines and teddy oats in small bowl. cook, stirring frequently, until slightly dried

dfa22ec3cd.gt:
Combine (sift, if possible) the whole wheat flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder.
Add the olive oil to the dry ingredients and mix until crumbly.
Add the milk a little at a time, kneading until it forms a dough.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap, then chill in the refrigerator for 20 to 30 minutes.
If you're in a hurry, you can skip this step.
Dust your working surface with flour, then knead the dough, just a little bit.
Do not knead too much.
Evenly spread out the dough, then cut into desired shapes.
I use a cup to cut them into circles!
Then all you need to do is bake them for 20 minutes in an oven preheated to 170C.
Keep an eye on the oven and adjust the baking time.
They're done!
If they don't taste sweet enough, serve them with maple syrup or your choice of sweetener.
Have them for breakfast.
I found them delightful.
dfa22ec3cd.pred:
combine all the dry ingredients in a big bowl
 add the oils and milk and mix to a soft, smooth dough
 knead the dough for 5 7 mins, and roll it out to an 8 inch circle
 spread the dough with a little oil in the center and sprinkle some flour on the surface.
 fold the dough over in thirds and shape into a loaf.
 cover with oiled cling film and let rest for 30 mins
 preheat the oven to 170 c
 place the loaf in an oven proof dish and sprinkle it with flour
 place in the oven and bake for 60 minutes or until the crust is golden

459ea331bf.gt:
Process all ingredients in a blender until smooth, stopping to scrape down sides.
Serve immediately.
459ea331bf.pred:
1. in small bowl, combine raspberry sorbate and strawberries, stirring gently until coated.
 2. place 1 cup 250 mil.
 strawberry mixture, blueberries and yogurt in blender.
 cover and blend on high speed, stopping once to scrape down sides.
 3. stop and scrape bowl.
 stop and stir.
 4. add cranberry jam or other desired berries to blender. add jam slurry and remaining ingredients.
 blend until smooth.
 5. pour into glasses and serve.

587189f28c.gt:
Okay.. so, not everyone is going to be extremely lucky like we were and have their friends spend over 12 hours smoking a pork shoulder with pineapple injection and giving you a Tupperware full to go home with...
But if you are or you know how to smoke your own.. this recipe is super exciting.
Spread out some delicious, crunchy tortilla chips, (I used Calidad brand) on a small baking sheet and cover with shredded cheese of your choice,( again, I used marble cheddar), be thorough, every hates a cheeseless chip.
Put in oven on 350 for about 3-4 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Take chips out of the oven and sprinkle with sliced black olives
Add a moderate layer of refried beans and another layer of cheese and stick back in the oven for 2 minutes
Sprinkle with Tapatio(or your favorite hot sauce
Spread a layer of your shredded meat and another layer of cheese.
Place back in oven for two more minutes.
Get out your salsa, sour cream and guacamole!
I just sliced up an avocado :P. Its time to eat!
587189f28c.pred:
1 preheat oven to 450 degrees.
 2 in a medium sized fry pan, add the olives, hot sauce, and a few dashes of if you like.
 3 add the meat and cook till cooked through. remove and set aside.
 4 when cool enough to handle, shred the meat by hand or using a fork, making sure you break up the meat.
 5 in enchilada pan, start assembling the nacho pieces, starting with the tortilla chips, reserving a small amount for later.
 6 add the shredded pork to the nachna mixture. top with shredded tortilla and cover with cheese.
 7 top with more shredded shredded veggie, then add the second 1/2 cup of cheese, the last of the re fried beans and the last bit of cheese. repeat until all nachoes are used and bake till the cheese has melted. enjoy

400c858727.gt:
1.
Place cocoa in a medium saucepan.
Gradually whisk in milk until cocoa has dissolved.
Add chocolate chips and crushed peppermint; simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until chocolate and peppermint have melted, 8 to 10 minutes.
2.
Bring to a boil and immediately remove from heat.
Ladle into mugs and top with mini marshmallows.
Serve each with peppermint sticks, if desired.
400c858727.pred:
in a large saucepan, combine cocoa and milk over medium heat, stirring constantly until thoroughly combined. bring to a simmer, whisking frequently.
 remove from heat. add morsel and crushed pepper mints whisk until blended. place marshmallows in mugs pour hot chocolate over marshmallows.
 to assemble, add 1/2 cup cocoa to each mug. microwave on high 30 to 60 seconds or until melted. let stand 3 to 5 minutes for marshmallows to soften.

7e82f5698a.gt:
Mix together the ground lamb, basmati rice, 2 tablespoons tomato puree, 1/2 teaspoon mint, salt, and pepper; mix well, and set aside.
Slice the ends off of the zucchinis and hollow out the centers using an apple corer.
Stuff with lamb mixture.
Stir together the remaining tomato puree with 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large skillet.
Place the stuffed zucchini into the sauce, and add enough water to cover the zucchini.
Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Stir in the garlic, lemon juice, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of mint.
Recover, and simmer an additional 15 minutes.
To serve, cut the zucchini crosswise into rounds and arrange on a serving plate.
Spoon sauce over the top.
7e82f5698a.pred:
mix ground lamb with rice in large bowl. stir in 1/2 cup drippings from pan, along with salt, pepper and 1/2 teaspoon mint. place in 2 12x8x2 inch ovenproof baking dishes. cover and bake at 350f until meat thermometer inserted in center registers 165 f, about 1 hour.

 meanwhile, combine squash and 1/2 cup of drubbing liquid from pan in heavy large pot. add salt and garlic and cook over medium heat until zucchini has softened, about 5 minutes. add lemon juice and mint and cook until squash is very tender, about 10 minutes. drain.
 turn squash in dish top each with 1/4 cup tomato mixture. cover with foil and bake until squash begins to brown and is tender when pierced with fork, about 15 minutes more. serve at once.

b384c81283.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the frozen berries, sugar, cornstarch and 1/2 cup of the crisp topping into a medium mixing bowl and stir to combine.
Divide the mixture evenly between 4 ramekins (7-8oz size).
Top each ramekin with 1/2 cup of the remaining crisp topping.
Place ramekins on a sheet pan and bake in the middle rack of the oven for 30-35 minutes or until the fruit is bubbling and the topping is browned.
Allow to cool for 1 minutes before serving.
Crisp topping.
Place the flour, sugar, nuts and cookies into a large mixing bowl and combine.
Work the butter into with your hands until it is crumbly.
Store in the refrigerator for up to a week.
Use as topping for crisps, cobblers or grunts.

36b3caf34c.gt:
Preheat the oven to 325.
In a large enameled cast-iron casserole, heat the peanut oil.
Season the pork with salt and pepper.
Add the shanks to the casserole and cook over moderate heat, turning, until browned all over, about 20 minutes; transfer to a plate.
Add the onion to the casserole and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 4 minutes.
Stir in the water, miso, brown sugar, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, chiles and scallions.
Add the shanks and any juices and bring to a boil.
Cover and braise in the oven for 2 hours, until the pork is very tender.
Garnish with scallions and serve with rice.

f0e77c97c6.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Brown onion, garlic and ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat for about 4 minutes.
Add red pepper flakes and continue cooking until the ground beef is fully cooked.
(If using fresh cabbage, add here and cook until soft.)
Drain extra fat out of the skillet then stir in drained sauerkraut and Worcestershire.
Heat through and set aside.
Press 1 package of crescent roll dough into the bottom of a lightly greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Spread beef mixture on top and cover with cheese.
Lay second package of crescent roll dough over the top of the beef and cheese mixture.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown.
f0e77c97c6.pred:
heat oven to 375 f. lightly spray a 13 x 9 inch glass casserole dish with cooking spray set aside.
 cook spaghetti in boiling water for 7 minutes, or until it is just al dente. drain in colander, then rinse well. set aside in coarsly chilled bowl.
 heat oil in a large saute pan, or wok over medium high heat until hot.
 add onion, spinach, meat, garlic, italian season, and red pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until meat is done, about 7 minutes.
 toss in sauerbraten and cook until liquid has evaporated and meat is starting to brown, 2 to 3 minutes. stir in cabbage, parmesean, and black pepper and 1 cup cheese. season, to taste, with salt and pepper. pour in veg. oil and cook another 5 minutes. transfer to prepared casserole dish.
 combine 3 cups cooked spaghetti and sour cream and pour over meat mixture. spread evenly. top with remaining shredded cheese and bake, uncovered, until cheese is bubbly and lightly browned, 15 to 20 minutes. let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

d7fcbdcf2c.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Cream Crisco with both types of sugar.
To this mixture, add eggs (unbeaten), water, vanilla, flour, salt and soda.
Combine.
In another bowl, mix together oatmeal, nuts and chocolate chips.
Add to original mixture.
This dough will be very full, I prefer to mix it at this point with my hands.
Put teaspoonfuls of dough on a cookie sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.
My children called their great grandmother (my grandmother) GeeGee.
She died last summer from cancer, so these cookies are very sentimental to us.
They are, the best chocolate chip cookies ever.
Hands down.
Thanks GeeGee!
We love you and miss you!

2615f04030.gt:
Warm milk, water, honey, and tea in the microwave for 2 minutes.
Enjoy!

1 in mug, combine 1 teaspoon 1 teaspoon 12 teaspoons/14 mmm honey vanilla tea bag, 1 1/4 teaspoon 6 tablespoon/43 mml.
 2 add 1/2 teaspoon 7 mts/40 mll.
 milk, 1 1/2 teaspoon 1/8 pinches/ 1/4 teaspoon 7/8 mrs. dash 1/2 teaspoon 6/16 m ms.
 3 stir together 2 teaspoon 10 mz.
 honey vanilla vanilla liqueur or 2 tablespoons 125 milb.
 tea bag.
 pour into mug.
 4 pour 2 teaspoon 5 m

d34f8abc06.gt:
Saute pepper and onion in skillet with Pam.
Add soup, Rotel tomatoes and chicken.
Alternate layers of tortillas and soup mix.
Sprinkle cheese on top.
Bake at 325F for 40 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
Serves 4.
WW Points: 5 pt.
d34f8abc06.pred:
heat skillet over medium high heat until hot.

 add bell pepper, onion, garlic and chili peppers. cook 5 minutes or until crisp tender. remove from skillet and set aside.
 combine soups and tomato sauce in skillet. heat to boiling.
 return veggies to skillet and add chicken.
 add wyoming, stir gently.
 spoon 1/3 cup of mixture into each tortilla shell.
 roll up place seam side down in a 9x13 inch baking dish. spoon sauce over enfoil.
 bake uncovered at 375 f 190 c for 20 minutes.

ede4b858c3.gt:
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil over both sides of each mushroom.
Sprinkle the mushrooms with salt and pepper.
Grill until the mushrooms are heated through and tender, about 5 minutes per side.
Meanwhile, add the extra-virgin olive oil and garlic in a medium bowl, and whisk until well blended.
Toss the tomatoes, cheese, and basil until evenly coated.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Place 4 hot grilled mushrooms gill side up on 4 individual plates.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper if needed.
Fill up the mushroom cap with the bruschetta and cheese mixture.
Drizzle a little bit more extra-virgin olive oil over if needed.
Serve and enjoy!
ede4b858c3.pred:
in a large pot or dutch oven, heat the 3 cups or 4 cups for the tomato basil broth over medium high heat until hot.
 add the beer and heat through, 2 to 3 minutes.
 meanwhile, in sprayed with cooking spray, warm the 3 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat until just smoking. add the mushrooms, portabellos, squash and parmesnan cheese and cook, stirring frequently, for 10 to 12 minutes, until browned and tender, but not soft. remove the mixture from the heat, and set aside.

 in another pot, heat 2 tablespoon olive or vegetable oil over low heat. add a dash or two of salt and the black pepper, and toss in the cauliflower. cook, tosping frequently, until the cauliflower is tender, 3 to 4 minutes. add 2 tablespoon of gf salt.
 remove pot

df0f792c26.gt:
Open amount of cans as needed.
Usually, one 15 oz can Enchilada Sauce per two two 4 oz Cans Green Chili.
Drain green chilies, Hatch Chilies always being best but do as you can, [we save the juices for later use here] mix both and heat in microwave or on stove.
Double or triple recipe as needed.
Feel free to add fresh Cilantro or even shredded pork or chicken if you have it.
Pour this sauce over most any Mexican dish!
These are a few great Enchilada Sauce brands we enjoy here in Albuquerque that are redily available.
A tip?
Don't tell anybody how easy this sauce is.
They really won't believe you.
Enjoy!
df0f792c26.pred:
1. in a sauce pan, combine the hot sauce, chilis and cumin and heat over medium heat until hot. add the sliced pork and heat through, 3 to 4 minutes. remove from heat and add the chili s and green chiles. ladle the sauce into individual soup bowls and garnish with chopped olives and cilantro.

 note you can make the sauce ahead of time and freeze it.

54c3982f16.gt:
Place the bowl and blade of a food processor into the freezer to chill for 4 to 5 hours.
Refit the bowl and blade, turn on the food processor, and pour the cream through the feed tube.
Continue to process for about 10 minutes, until the Butter has hardened around the blade, leaving the liquid that has separated from the cream in the bottom of the bowl.
Transfer the Butter to a fine sieve and shake 2 or 3 times over the sink to allow any excess liquid to drain.
Put the butter in a bowl, cover, and chill for at least 1 hour before using.
Store it in the refrigerator, where it has a shelf life of about 1 week.
While holding the ruler, grab the end of the top layer of wax paper and slowly pull it toward you; this will form the Butter into the shape of a log.
Roll the paper around the log and chill.
Serve whole or cut off medallions as needed.
54c3982f16.pred:
in a small pan, bring the salt, pepper, and 1/4 cup 50 m.
 in teh saucepan, heat the cream over medium high heat and cook, stirring often, for about 10 minutes until the mixture becomes thick.
 the cream will begin to bubble, then stop stirring it will stick to the pan.
 remove from the heat.
 stir in 1 cup 225 m or less of the kirsch the water should be just about at room temp as soon as it is added to the cream, but not as quickly as the cream.
 you can whisk this mixture occasionally to keep it thick and stiff if you like.
 it will look like it is going to curdle, just keep whisking and being careful not to lose any of the moisture.
 pour the cold kirsche into a glass container or pitcher with a lid.
 cover and refrigerate it for at least a couple of hours or overnight.
 when you are ready to serve it, just whip the mixture with rotary beaters or an electric mixer or by hand with whipped cream until it holds stiff peaks.
 fold in 1/2 cup 70 g kirschen to a cup or so of the cold cream and mix well.
 chill if it sets too much before serving, it will have the consistency of whipped butter.
 if youre making the sauce from this, you will get the texture as much as you like.

5765949efb.gt:
Combine sugar, pecans and orange peel in small bowl.
Melt butter in small bowl in microwave.
Cut cream cheese into 20 pieces the size of butter pat.
Seperate each biscuit in half part way and place cream cheese piece in and pinch edges back together.
Do all 20 biscuits.
Then dip in melted butter and dredge in sugar, pecan mixture.
Stand upright in lightly greased 12 cup bundt pan, space evenly.
Drizzle any remaining butter over and sprinkle with any remaining sugar,pecan mixture.
Bake at 350-375F for 45 minutes or until golden brown.
Immediately invert onto plate.
Combine powdered sugar, cinnamon and water, stir well.
Drizzle over hot bread.
Serve warm.

1bdaace83f.gt:
Use 2 1/2- to 2 3/4-inch heart-shaped cookie cutter coated with cooking spray to cut out heart from each KELLOGG'S POP-TARTS FROSTED CHERRY toaster pastry.
Use white frosting to write the words "Be Mine" on each.
1bdaace83f.pred:
mix pudding according to package instructions.
 i used pillsbury refrigerated jiffy mix.
 spread some jhoney on one sheet of patty cake wrappers.
 place one pattie in a sprayed 9x13 baking pan.
 add another petticoat and repeat with the other pattecoat and pagnecoat.
 don t forget the foil wrappers for last layer.
 spray em with cooking spray or grease the pans with butter.
 bake for 15 minutes on 375 degrees.
 do not preheat ovens.
 remove cake wrapper from pan. spread filling along cut side of a pastry bag or the piquecoat. i found that a plastic food bag i do works the best and it was easy to get out of the bag.
 with a knife, pull over the bottom corner to get a pocket in the middle, pushing the sides of the tiffin to the icing. if you don.
 take a small portion of the frosting and put in the top corner of the toaster.
 frost the pastry with the frosting.
 now you can decorate the top of each tummy s face with other ingredients, as desired.
 they can be made a day ahead.

dfe6f1be35.gt:
Heat unsalted butter in a stainless steel, thick-bottomed sauce pan, over a low-medium flame.
Allow the oil (ghee) to separate from the milk solids.
Periodically remove the foam that accumulates at the top.
When the oil is clear in color, the ghee is done.
Remove from the stove and allow to cool for a while, than carefully pour off the ghee into a wide-mouthed jar through several layers of cheese cloth secured to the opening of the jar or through a fine mesh strainer.
Cover the jar and store at room temperature.
dfe6f1be35.pred:
preheat the oven to 450f.
 cut the squash crosswise into thick wedges, place them cut side up in a roasting pan and sprinkle them with salt.
 scatter the butter chunks over the squash, roast the squash in the oven for 20 minutes, or until the skin is crisp.
 sprinkle the shredded cheese over the flesh of the squash and bake for 5 to 10 more minutes or until golden.
 transfer to a platter and serve immediately.

669da1896f.gt:
Peel the pears, cut them into quarters and remove the cores.
Cut each quarter in half and put them in a bowl.
Shave the cheese with a vegetable peeler and mix three-quarters of it with the pears.
Beat the oil and the lemon juice together and add salt and pepper to taste.
Spoon about half this dressing over the pears and leave for 1 hour.
Spoon the pears into a deep dish and shower with the remaining cheese.
Surround with the rocket and drizzle the rest of the dressing over it.
Serve immediately.
Serves 4.
669da1896f.pred:
preheat the oven to 400 f.
 halve and core the pears, leaving the skins on. sprinkle them with a little salt. put them cut side down on a cookie sheet with the rounded sides facing down. bake for 20 minutes, then turn them over and cook another 10 15 minutes or until the sliced sides are starting to get tender. remove them from the oven and cool until you can safely handle them. when cool enough to handle, slice them thinly on the diagonal. put the slices in a bowl and toss them gently with evoo, lemon juice and olive oil. taste it and adjust the seasoning and set aside in crock, tossed with the rocket leaves, arugula leaves, white pepper and then the risotto.

 on top of the salad, layer the parmesean cheese and then a pat of butter.

d46848fda2.gt:
In a medium bowl, add rice flour, all-purpose flour, bread crumbs, turmeric, cumin powder, red chili, mango powder, salt, water and make a thick paste.
Set aside.
Cut 1/2 inch thick round pieces of the eggplant.
This will give total of 10 pieces.
Heat the large nonstick pan on high, dab oil and reduce heat to medium.
Take 1 round piece of eggplant, dip it into the batter, making sure its evenly coated on both sides, and put it on the heated pan.
After 2 minutes, turn to the other side and cook for another 2 minutes.
Check both the sides to make sure they are evenly golden brown.
Continue until all eggplant pieces are cooked.
Serve hot.
d46848fda2.pred:
put the first 9 ingredients in a bowl. mix thoroughly.
 put the flour mixture and water in ould machine, process according to manufacturer s instructions, 1 minute on low speed. scrape down bowl as necessary.

 remove olfi n n with a small metal spatula and set on a well floured cutting board. sprinkle salt on top. roll the dough, starting at the longer edge.
 with your fingertips, press down on the dough to form a ball.
 divide the ball into 10 small balls. working fast, flatten into rounds, 1 inch thick.
 remove the bottoms of the rounds to create nice, neat rounds.
 heat 2 tablespoons of oil in frying pan until very hot and fry the rounds over low heat, till golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes on each side. do not turn the rounds too soon they will be rubbery and dry.
 drain the rounds on absorbent paper towels.
 serve hot or reheat at 300 degrees.

f5564fb5c4.gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut cheese slices into quarters, then cut each piece diagonally in half.
Place crackers in single layer on baking sheet; top with ham and cheese.
Bake 4 to 5 min.
or until cheese is melted.
Top with preserves and onions.
f5564fb5c4.pred:
note i thouroughly made this this time using the fajita burgers.
 the southwestern style recipe on this site uses fresh mozzarella, but its a good idea if you can t get it, simply buy it in a bag.
 cut the cheese into 24 1 1/2 inch round slices.
 set aside.
 on each cracker, place one slice of cheese, ham and berries.
 sprinkle each santa lion evenly with mustard.
 in small bowl, combine preserves, mustard and oil.
 stir in 1/4 cup hot sauce and spread mixture over peach slices

8220c924d4.gt:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain.
While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Cook onion just until softened, about 3 minutes.
Stir in the curry powder and garam masala.
Stir in the pumpkin.
Slowly pour in the chicken broth and heavy cream.
Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until thickened slightly, 3 5 minutes.
Add pasta to the sauce and toss to coat.
Stir in salt.
Add more if desired.
Transfer pasta to a serving dish, sprinkle with green onions and serve.
8220c924d4.pred:
heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the yellow onions and saute until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes. add in the diced red peppers, and continue to saut until the onions are tender, about 8 to 10 minutes.
 add the curry powder and garam marsala. continue to cook until aromatic, about 1 minute. add pumpkin and stir well.
 slowly add the chicken broth to the pan, and allow the liquid to boil until it has reduced by about half, about 2 to 3 minutes. reduce the heat to low, and stir in the cream. cook for 30 seconds to 1 minute to reduce the cream and create an emulsion. add a generous amount of koshte to taste if needed. remove from the heat.
 toss the pasta in the pan and reheat over medium low. stir in articholinos, green onions and artichons. add salt to taste, and tos it all together. serve and enjoy

f951ae3f61.gt:
Light the grill.
In a food processor, puree the butter and olives with the anchovy paste, orange zest, orange juice, garlic, and pepper.
With a rubber spatula, scrape the butter into a small bowl and refrigerate.
Rub the hens with oil and cook over moderate heat for 12 minutes.
Turn and cook until just done, about 12 minutes longer.
Remove the hens from the grill and serve with the rice.
Top each serving with 2 tablespoons of the flavored butter, letting the butter melt over both the hen and the rice.
f951ae3f61.pred:
1. adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 375. butter a 13 x 9 inch glass baking dish. in a mixing bowl, toss the potatoes and butter in it until they are thoroughly coated. add the mustard and the next nine ingredients tosing gently until completely coated. spread the potatoes in the prepared baking dish, filling the pan all the way to the rim. place the chickens around the edges of the baking dish to cover them completely. add enough hot water to come halfway up the sides of the chicken breasts. cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil.
 3. bake the hen cups for 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes, or until fork tender. remove the p

a040895990.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Mix together all ingredients except olive oil and garlic.
Place olive oil in the bottom of a casserole dish or square glass baking dish.
Rub the dish with one bulb of chopped garlic and leave the garlic in the dish.
Pour mixture into baking dish and bake for 30-40 minutes at 325 degrees.

3427daffb8.gt:
Mix the oils and teriyaki sauce in a skillet, and warm over medium heat.
Baste eggs in skillet, turning constantly, until eggs turn dark brown (5 minutes).
Remove eggs from pan.
Mix garlic salt and pepper into oils in skillet.
Stirfry broccoli until tender crisp (3 minutes), then melt cheese on top.
Serve eggs with broccoli.

combine the olive oil, sambal, sesama saki and teryaki in a small bowl.
 whisk the eggs in teflon coated skillet or griddle until frothy and no white streaks appear.
 pour a large spoonful of the egg mixture into the center of the skillet.

 when the eggs just begin to set on the surface, sprinkle the rice over the top of the eggs and rice.
 sprinkle the seasonings over the rice. optional ingredients onion, red and yellow peppers, chopped, fresh cilantro.

 add the broccoli and spinach. cover the skillet and cook over low heat for 4 5 minutes, until the broccoli is tender crisp.
 mix in cheeses and continue cooking, covered, until cheese melts.
 if desired, serve with hot sauce.

66711973a2.gt:
Mix together the cake mix, butter, egg, and vanilla until blended.
Press into the bottom of greased 9x13 pan.
Sprinkle the peanuts and M&Ms on the cake mix.
Place the cookie chunks on top.
Drizzle the condensed milk all over everything.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 30-35 minutes.
Let cool before cutting into the bars.
Note: These bars can be made with any flavor of Oreo and M&M candy.

 5. add egg to dry mixture.

0fc7e26c7e.gt:
In bowl, whisk together dressing and sun-dried tomatoes; reserve.
Arrange arugula on platter.
Top with rows of celery and tomatoes on one side and olives and artichoke hearts on the other.
Fold slices of cheese and salami into quarters; arrange in center of salad.
Drizzle salad with dressing.

in a medium bowl, stir together the oil, vinegar, sun dried and parsley.
 taste, and add more dressing or vinegar as needed.

 add the cooled parsley/greens mixture and tos just to blend.
 pour the italian dressing over the druguls and vegetables.
 tos well.

 divide the salad among bowls.

b150cd3f5e.gt:
Grease and flour a standard loaf pan.
Preheat oven to 350F.
Combine first 7 ingredients in bowl of food processor and pulse a few times to mix.
Add butter and one egg.
Process until mixture is moistened.
With machine running, add remaining ingredients, scraping bowl as necessary.
Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes, or until tester comes out clean.
Cool in pan 10 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool on rack.
b150cd3f5e.pred:

 mix the dry ingredients flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger in a large bowl. add the butter and rub the butter in with your fingertips until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.

 turn the biscottis over and bake another 20 30 minutes, until golden and firm. let the biscoi cool completely before storing in an airtight container.

4b92540ad2.gt:
heat oven to 425
line 9in pie plate with pastry
combine lemon juice with flour,sugar,nutmeg,cinnamon,lemon rind
place half of apples in plate, sharp edges inward
sprinkle with half of sugar mixture
top with rest of apples, heaping in center sprinkle with rest of sugar mixture
dot with butter
adjust top crust as directed and glaze
bake 40-50min or until apples test tender with fork and crust is brown

3fe0a3e464.gt:
1.
Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil.
Add soba; cook 3 minutes.
Add broccoli to pan; cook 3 minutes or until soba and broccoli are done.
Drain.2.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.
Coat pan with cooking spray.

put bread on plate and spread mustard on all 4 pieces
put pan on stove n heat on medium , spray pay with cooking spray then put in bologna one at a time and it will bubble up like a hat , press down with a spatula then turn over and continue doing the same thing .

022318dd52.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Spray a large casserole dish with cooking spray.
(I have a 4 quart casserole dish I use for this.)
In a large skillet, brown together ground beef and onion; drain grease and return to pan.
Add tomato sauce, mushroom soup, 1/2 cup of the cheese, salt, pepper, and garlic.
Simmer uncovered.
While meat mixture is simmering, cook the pasta according to package directions.
Combine the pasta and the meat mixture together in the casserole dish; mix well.

b7d53a2696.gt:
Make the cookie base: Position a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Put the butter in a food processor, along with the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt.
Pulse until the mixture is well combined (about 20 pulses).
Scatter the dough into a 9x9-inch baking pan and press it evenly over the bottom.
(Wipe out the processor bowl but don’t bother washing it.)
Bake the base until firm and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.
When the cookie base comes out of the oven, sprinkle the grated chocolate evenly over the top.
(Don’t turn off the oven.)
Set the pan aside.
Make the pecan topping: As the cookie base bakes, pulse the pecans in the food processor until coarsely chopped.
In a medium-size heavy saucepan, melt the butter.
Stir in the dark brown sugar, honey, cream, and salt.
Simmer for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the pecans.
Pour the pecan mixture over the chocolate-sprinkled cookie base, spreading evenly.
Bake until much of the filling is bubbling (not just the edges), 16 to 18 minutes.
Let cool completely in the pan.
When ready to serve, cut into 16 squares.
Tightly covered, these bars will keep for about five days (though they never last that long).

fe5d11c597.gt:

Combine 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup margarine in large mixer bowl.

Variations: Before putting frosting over cooled cookies, spread a thin layer of peanut butter, caramel, or seedless raspberry jelly over marshmallow, and then add your frosting.

Pour balsamic vinegar into skillet and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer until balsamic vinegar mixture is reduced by half, about 10 minutes.

Cut chicken breasts from one side through the middle horizontally to within one-half inch of the other side.
Open the two sides and spread them out like an open book.

Delicious!

You can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese on top to serve.

When one side is browned, turn the pancake over.

When the pancake is cooked, spread the combined okonomiyaki and takoyaki sauces, fold in half and press.
If you add too much squid, the pancakes will be hard to cook.
I'm not too good at cooking these myself.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Pour the mixture over the potatoes in the baking dish, stirring to coat evenly.

Bake 1/2 hour longer, stir the potato mixture again, and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes more.

Spoon batter into pan spreading evenly.

Cool torte in pan.

Sprinkle 6 wedges with cocoa, remaining 6 wedges with confectioners sugar.
Arrange wedges alternately on cake plate.

Let stand 5 minutes, then serve.

e531d7ab07.gt:
Cut the fat cap side off of the beef.
Rinse meat in water, then place in a slow cooker.
Sprinkle all sides of meat with salt generously.
Add up to 4 cups of baby carrots to the slow cooker.
Fill a large measuring cup with 4 cups of hot water.
Pour contents of seasoning envelope into the water and stir until blended.
Pour water and seasoning into the slow cooker.
Set slow cooker to cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
If you only have 6 to 8 hours for cooking, set slow cooker on high for the last 3 hours, or all of the cooking time.
Additional ingredients can be added to the slow cooker during preparation, such as: quartered red potatoes, sliced celery, sliced onions, green peas.
If adding these extra ingredients, you may need to use a smaller meat portion in order to fit everything in your slow cooker.
My preference is to cook the largest meat portion I can and prepare mashed potatoes just before serving.
This option provides enough meat for pot roast leftovers the next night and two nights of beef enchiladas through the week.
Check out my recipes for Easy Extraordinary Mashed Potatoes and Pot Roast Turned Enchiladas.

Combine the flour and cocoa powder, and sift.
Preheat the oven for 170C.

Pour the mixture into the ramekins.

When you bake too long, the inside won't be creamy, so bake until just the surface is cooked.
Once it's cooled, you can microwave for 20 seconds at 600 W, and the creaminess on the inside will come back.

Even when you are using baking ceramic crocks, check them after about 10 minutes of baking.

If the edge is not liquidy, you can take it out from the oven.

 line the baking pan with the baking paper, allowing 4 inches to hang over the edges.
 place the eggs and sugar in twilight bowl and stir for 4 minutes until the egg yolks are clear and the sugar is dissolved.
 add the flour and cocoa. set aside for 5 minutes.
 stir the eggs into the chocolate mixture.
 pour into the prepared pan, smoothing the top.
 using a spatula, pat down into an even layer.
 bake for 22 to 27 minutes, until the edges begin to pull away from the sides of the pan.
 let cool completely on a wire rack.

8c25573d0e.gt:
In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar until fluffy.
Beat in flour.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Roll out onto a well-floured surface to 1/4-in.
thickness.
Brush lightly with egg.
Sprinkle with almonds and sugar if desired.
Using a fluted pastry cutter or knife, cut into 2-in.
x 1-in.
strips.
Place 1 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 10-12 minute or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.
8c25573d0e.pred:
cream together the butter, honey and 1 cup of the granulated sugar until fluffy and light.
 beat in the flour, a little at a time, allowing each addition to blend in before adding the next.
 then beat in egg and chopped parsley or nutmeg.
 knead or process almonds, 1/4 cup of granualted sugar, and salt until mixed and well blended.
 divide dough in half.
 roll one half into a 12 x 12 inch rectangle on a floured surface.
 spread with almond filling, leaving a 1/2 inch border around the edge.
 sprinkle with colored sugar, or the surface with plain sugar.
 cut the rectangle in half crosswise and again into 1/4 inch wide strips.
 twist strip slightly to form a spiral.
 transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet, twist ends and set aside.
 repeat this procedure with other half of dough.
 chill cookies for 1 to 2 hours.
 heat oven to 350 degrees f and bake cookies for 25 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.
 cool on trays.
 store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.
 variation
 make ahead the cookies can be refrigerated for upto 5 days.

b7bd1b9a99.gt:
Combine 1 cup broth and butter in small saucepan.
Bring to boil over high heat.
Continue to boil until liquid is reduced to 1/4 cup and has a syrupy consistency, about 15-20 minutes.
Stir in cream.
Set aside.
Bring remaining 12 cups broth to a boil in Dutch oven.
Add egg noodles and celery; cook until noodles are tender.
Stir in reserved cream mixture; add chicken.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, add parsley.
Heat just to serving temperature.
Do not boil.
b7bd1b9a99.pred:
1. heat broth in large saucepan over medium high heat. add condendensed milk and butter. bring to boil over medium heat.

 2. add remaining ingredients except cheese stir to mix well. reduce heat to low cover and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes. stir in cheese, mrs.
 dash and pepper. remove from heat. stir noodles into soup until noodles are incorporated and mixture is heated through.

d899465f16.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees .
Spray 2 loaf pans with baking spray (oil + flour)I use Bakers Joy in the blue can.
In a large bowl, add your mushy bananas, white sugar and melted butter.
Use a fork to mash them all together.
Dont worry about the banana lumps, its all good!
Add eggs and mix with a fork to combine.
Add all the dry ingredients and mix with a large spoon or spatula to combine (no need to break out the mixer for this one!).
Now add your sour cream and vanilla.
Divide mixture between your 2 loaf pans.
(Its ok that it only fills them each 1/2 way upthis loaf will rise!
I made the mistake once of putting all the batter in one pan.
Total overflow to the max!)
For the streusel topping, combine brown sugar, white sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl.
Sprinkle generously on top of each unbaked loaf.
Bake at 325 degrees for about an hour (check after 50 minutes in case your oven runs hot), until a toothpick inserted in center of the loaf comes out clean.
This banana bread is so moist and flavorful, youll never look back!
d899465f16.pred:
1.in food processor, pulse 2 cups 170g ripened bananas to paste. whisk in baking soda, baking powder, baking soda/salt, cinnamon and nutmolly whisk well. transfer mixture to large bowl.
 2.in food mixer, cream butter and sugar, adding another cup 150g. add egg and beat until creamy. add remaining 1 cup 200g frosted apple pieces and 1 cup 180g vanilla extract.
 3.mix in flour and baking soda mixture until dough comes together. this helps prevent sticking.
 4.in large bowl, stir together flour, baking poda, baking sugar, baking and ground cloves, sour. cream until light and fluffy. fold into batter. mix until batter is uniform.
 5.in medium bowl, blend cinnamon and almonds into batter and then stir in flour mixture.
 6.

c79defe8f0.gt:
Prepare the potatoes by cutting each into wedges lengthwise about 8 wedges for each potatoes.
Place in a bowl with ice cubes and add water to cover.
Place in fridge for at least 45 minutes.
Drain and pat with paper towels to dry.
Melt butter with minced garlic salt and pepper.
I usually use a cast iron skillet, but any oven-proof pan will do.
Pour butter over potatoes in skillet, the butter mixture will stick because the potatoes are so cold!
Bake in a 425 degree oven about 25 minutes.
Broasted!
c79defe8f0.pred:
wash the russet and other baking potatoes well and dry with paper towels. then, in a mixing bowl, lightly smear one teaspoon or more of the butter with half the salt and half the pepper.

 preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
 using a large fork, make holes all over the potatoes in each one, making sure to separate the ends. using he tongs, dip each potato into the butter and coat the first side well, placing it on a baking sheet sprayed with nonstick spray.

 after the first batch of potatoes are coated, sprinkle all over with the remaining salt and pepper, and then add the remainder of the sliced butter, rubbing each time in between your fingers until it is in tiny bits.
 pour any butter left in the bowl over the top of the potato mixture. using the back of a fork or the tines of your fork and your fingers, gently pinch each potato lightly together to form an even layer.
 if the butter doesnt completely cover the potatoes, add more, pressing down firmly into the potato top.
 drizzle with the hot water and use your hands to distribute the potatoes evenly, working

a22e0c83cf.gt:
1.
Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat.
Drain.
Place pasta in a large bowl; keep warm.2.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion; saute 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add garlic and tomatoes; saute 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Sprinkle shrimp with Cajun seasoning, red pepper, and salt.
Add shrimp mixture to pan; saute 3 minutes or until shrimp are almost done; remove from heat.
Stir in half-and-half.
Pour shrimp mixture over pasta; toss.
Sprinkle with parsley.Wine note: Linguine with Spicy Shrimp combines peppery heat with a creamy sauce, making a fuller-bodied white a good partner.
Little Penguin Chardonnay 2008 ($6), from Australia, has tropical and pear fruit, with just a bit of sweetness and refreshing acidity.
--Jeffery Lindenmuth
a22e0c83cf.pred:
cook pasta according to package directions, drain.
 in 2 quart saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. add eggplant, onion, garlic, mince garlic, parsley, and tomatoes. cook and stir for 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. stir in sml chopped parsley. add shrimp and next 4 ingredients. cook until thoroughly heated.
 pour over hot pasta and toss to coat. garnish with remaining 3 tablespoons butter and parsley and serve immediately.

 note for testing purposes only, we used bisque original linguous vegetable pasta with johnny s shrimp and scallops pasta and seafood. we also used bisquick s all natural spaghetti sauce and no salt added diced tomato.

a2917226da.gt:
Place the tofu on a heat-resistant dish (preferably a deep dish) and cut into 6 pieces.
Of course you don't need to cut it at all.
Top with kimchi.
Cut the pork into easy to eat pieces and place on top of the kimchi.
Lightly cover with plastic wrap and microwave at 500 W for 3 minutes.
Since the meat doesn't cook completely through very easily, turn the meat over after about 2 minutes.
Once the pork has cooked through, pour in the sesame oil, soy sauce, and optionally garnish with green onion to finish.
a2917226da.pred:
cut the tofuite into 4ths. cut 1/8th of the way down the length. put the toffer, half of the onion, and half of all the marrow into a saucepan and cover with cold water. add the lees, salt, ginger and kum kee simmer covered for 20 minutes. add 1 cup of water and cook, covered for another 20 min or until tofute is soft. cut the cut tofum into small cubes and fry until lightly brown.

 in the meantime peel the chiles and remove the ribs, leaves and any blemishes. slice the shiso. chop the green onion finely.
 when the tomsame are cooked, remove tofus cube and fry in a non stick pan till browned. remove and set aside.
 add the onion in the pan and fry. when translucent add the pork and kimchi and stir well. add mutton and continue stirring.
 then add the drained tofeu flakes and the sesam ol, soy, konnyaku, soba and stir to mix well. taste and correct the seasoning. if you think it needs a bit of salt, add a little. remove from heat.
 serve hot and sprinkle with green onion slices.
 enjoy

b7705a9251.gt:
Saute -- In a large pan, heat the oil.
Add the garlic, onion and red pepper and saute for 2-3 minutes on medium until slightly soft.
Beans and spinach -- Add the beans, seasoning and saute on medium high to high until cooked through, about 5 minutes.
As they cook I like to take a fork and slightly mash the beans a bit to get a good consistency.
I like to get them a little crisp and browned but not fried dark brown.
Just a light browning is good.
Add the spinach and break up as it cooks.
If too dry you can use a little white wine, chicken broth or just water to loosen the sauce if necessary.
Garnish with some good olive oil and ground pepper.
b7705a9251.pred:
bring the broth to a boil, then lower the heat and add 1 tbsp olive oil.
 remove from heat, cover, and let stand overnight.
 in the morning, drain the beans, place in a pan with water, or a small soup kettle and simmer for an hour.
 chop the tomatoes and spinach.
 set aside.
 heat remaining 1 oz of olive oil in frying pan.
 sauteed onion until softened.
 add garlic and saut for 2 minutes.
 strain and set aside, keeping the onion chunks.
 now, add tomatoes, spinach, buttermilk cream, cottage cheese, parsley and rosemary.
 season with pepper, kosger salt, black pepper and olive oil, stir together to blend.
 put the wine in utensils.
 pour the blended mixture on top of the other ingredients.
 transfer everything to crock pot, cover and cook on high for 4 hours.
 serve sprinkled with freshly chopped herbs and/or sprinkled on top if you wish.
 for a change for croutons, omit the goat cheese and/ or olive oil and stir in the chopped fresh herbs.

a7cd3b464c.gt:
Heat oil in large saucepan or Dutch oven.
Add garlic, ginger, lemon peel and hot pepper flakes.
Cook gently until very fragrant.
Add broth, soy sauce and lemon juice and bring to boil.
Add carrots.
Reduce heat and simmer gently for 15 minutes.
Add scallops, shrimp, sesame oil and green onions, Cook for just a few minutes, or until seafood is barely cooked.
Serve sprinkled with cilantro.

83b98d7ee9.gt:
Saute diced onion in olive oil, add to crock pot.
Pour canned ingredients into crock pot, do not drain beans.
Add spices.
And the diced chicken.
(I used bagged chicken breast that was still partially frozen).
Heat on medium heat for 6 hours.
Microwave cream cheese for 45 seconds until it is easy to stir and pour.
Add the the soup.
Using a blender or immersion blender, blend until smooth.
Add 1 cup of favorite shredded cheese.
I used Colby Jack.
Hollow out your bead bowl if you so desire and pour soup into it.
Top with remaining shredded cheese.
83b98d7ee9.pred:
1 heat oil in large skillet
 2 add smoked sausage to skillet and brown,
 3 add onion and cook over med. heat 2 3 min
 4 add chopped sausage to vegetable mixture
 5 add tinned beans, broth, diced chicken and spices to skillet
 6 cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally 30 40 min, adding water as needed
 7 stir in cream cheese until cream cheese has melted. top soup with shredded cheddar.
 8 serve with bread bowls

128f70ff9b.gt:
Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
Heat the olive oil in a large, heavy pot over medium-high heat.
Stir in the onion, garlic, and serrano chili; cook until the onion has softened, about 1 minute.
Add the chicken, and continue to cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in the cilantro, peas, corn, and red pepper; cook for 1 minute.
Pour in the chicken broth, potatoes, and rice.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the chicken is opaque and the potatoes are tender, about 40 minutes.

86795284d9.gt:
In small saucepan bring broths, clam juice and Port to boil.
Season with pepper.
Divide scallops between 2 bowls.
Ladle over the very heated broth.
Garnish with the green onions or chives and serve.
86795284d9.pred:
combine the first nine ingredients in a large nonaluminum saucepan.
 heat over medium high heat until boiling.
 reduce heat to medium simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
 add scallops cook until scallops turn opaque in the center and the fish is tender, about 3 minutes. stir in the radicchio and next 3 ingredients.
 cover and simmer until heated through, about 1 minute.
 divide among individual bowls.
 serve immediately with homemade rye bread.

88e444eb93.gt:
Preheat oven to broil.
Line a baking sheet with foil.
Halve the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, jalapeno peppers, and serrano peppers lengthwise and discard stems and seeds.
Place on baking sheet and brush the peppers with olive oil.
Roast peppers under the broiler until the skin blackens and blisters, 3 to 5 minutes.
Place peppers in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap; allow the peppers to steam until the skins loosen, about 10 minutes.
Peel skin off the peppers and discard.
Combine the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, jalapenos, serrano, onion, tomato, garlic, cilantro, diced tomato with juice, lime juice, salt, black pepper, and beer in a blender.
Blend to desired consistency.
Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before serving.
88e444eb93.pred:
bring large pot of water to boil.
 in a small bowl, stir together the olive oil and chopped onion.
 drain well.
 place all the vegetables on a large plate and toss them with the olive/onion mixture.
 set aside.
 you can also grill the vegetables, either under a broiler, or on the stovetop under uncovered broiling burner.
 if cooking over the stove, this step should also be done on the top rack of your grill.

 remove from the flame, wrap them in tinfoil, and allow them to steam for 15 minutes. or you can use a gas stove top grill if your grill doesn t have a cover.
 peel and de seed the

bc57597208.gt:
Mix together all ingredients.
Salt should not be needed because of the anchovies.
bc57597208.pred:
boil the spaghetti until tender.
 toss the spaghetti with the ingredients and serve immediately.
 you can use this mixture for a quick marinade before cooking but there is no other way to do so at home.
 they also freeze well.

af9fb785aa.gt:
Preheat oven to 275F/135C.
In a large bowl toss oatmeal, coconut, nuts, and sunflower seeds together.
In a separate bowl whisk together oil, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla.
Pour liquid mixture over oats and stir until everything is coated.
Pour mixture into a large rimmed baking sheet.
I also cover the baking sheet with baking paper but it's not necessary if you have a non-stick pan.
Bake for approximately 20-25 minutes, stirring once or twice.
Keep an eye on it so it doesn't burn.
Let it cool completely.
Blend in cornflakes if using.
Store in an airtight container.
af9fb785aa.pred:
preheat oven to 300f. lightly grease a cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray.
 in a large bowl, mix together oaints, chocolate chips, almonds, walnuts, pecan pieces, sunflower seeds and any optional seasonings.

 bake for 30 minutes. then turn oven off and allow grana pad to cool in oven for 15 more minutes.
