 sprinkle with fresh lemon and serve.
 note this recipe can be halved for a juicier flavor. clam substitute crabmeat for shrimp. if you are using the shrimp, do not drain. omit the seasoning and add 1 tbsp 15 mrs. dash chicken seasoning with 3 tsp 7 mn olive oil and 1 lg. garlic clove.

0e47e93343.gt:
Place pork in a wide nonstick frying pan.
Drain about 1/2 cup liquid from tomatoes into pan.
Bring to a boil over high heat; then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Uncover pan; add onions, celery, oregano, and sage.
Cook over high heat, stirring often, until liquid has evaporated and drippings are browned (8 to 10 minutes).
Add bay leaves.
Cut up tomatoes then add tomatoes and their remaining liquid and stir to scrape browned bits free.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30 more minutes.
Stir in bell pepper and chilies; cover and continue to cook stirring occasionally until pork is very tender when pierced (about 15 more minutes).
If chili is too thin, uncover and simmer until it's as thick as you like.
Skim and discard fat, if necessary.
To serve, spoon chili over rice and garnish with cilantro sprigs.
0e47e93343.pred:
cut beef cube into 1/2 in. cube pieces, and saute in a 4 to 5 qb.
 dutch oven or stockpot until browned, then add cubed meat and sauc until done, about 20 minutes.
 add cube meat back into pot, along with 1 cup water, roasted tomatoes

863861f92e.gt:
Brown hamburger in large pot (you don't want to crumble it up too fine--big pieces are the best).
Make gravy and add to pot.
Let it simmer until heated.
Serve over mashed potatoes.
NOTE: You don't want this too runny--kind of thick and with big chunks of hamburger is the best.
863861f92e.pred:
brown the meat, drain off the grease, add the water and simmer 5 min. while the meat is simmering, make the potatoes. i boil the potatoes until they are soft. drain, mash, and set aside.
 after the meat mixture is browned, add to a skillet or griddle over medium heat with the gravy. mix together well and simmer until warm. if you prefer more gravy, you can use a small can of beef gravy and make the hamburgers as if making a main dish. to freeze the meat and gravy in the crock pot, you need to heat it in the microwave or on the stove on medium heat. just just before serving, spoon about 1/4 cup of gravy over the meat in the skillet, then top with the potatoes and a bit of extra gravy to make it even better.

6e11affa2e.gt:
In a small bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a 1 quart glass container (a mason jar works great!
), layer the flour mixture, sugar, brown sugar, oats, walnuts, cereal and cranberries.
Cover and store in a cool dry place for up to 6 months.
Write this note to go with your gift mix: To Prepare Cookies ~ In a large bowl, beat the softened butter, egg, water and vanilla until blended.
Add cookie mix and mix well.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 350F for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
6e11affa2e.pred:
preheat oven to 350 degrees.
 combine all dry ingredients in a bowl.
 in pampered chef, combine all wet ingredients except vanilla extract mix well.
 add extract if using and mix until combined.
 with wet mixture, mix in dry ingredients.
 place heaping tablespoon of the dough on a greased cookie sheet.
 dip your finger in water and lightly dunk the tip of the finger in the water and gently press down on the dough to flatten out the dough about 1/2 inch thick.
 bake the cookies for 15 to 20 minutes, until the cookies are golden brown.
 the edges will brown more as they cool.
 let cool completely on the cookie sheet and store in an airtight container.

86511b0045.gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees F.
Brown meat with onions in large ovenproof skillet; drain.
Return to skillet.
Whisk eggs and milk until blended.
Add to meat mixture along with the VELVEETA and relish; mix well.
Bake 20 to 25 min.
or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Top with tomatoes and lettuce.
86511b0045.pred:
heat overn to 350f.
 brown ground beef in nonstick skillet, stirring constantly drain if needed.
 stir in tomato sauce.
 bring to boiling reduce heat.
 simmer uncovered 3 5 minutes or until sauce thickens and vegeatables are heated through, stirring frequently.
 blend in cheese sauce.stir to blend.
 remove from heat.mix in remaining ingredients.
 serve warm over toasted rye bread.

df9193a49e.gt:
In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoons of the oil on high heat.
When hot, add the pork cubes and cook until soft.
Stir in the garlic, curry powder, coriander, cumin, and crushed red pepper.
Cook 1 minute.
Add ginger, cinnamon, bay leaf, salt, chicken broth, and tomato paste.
Bring liquid to a boil, cover and simmer on low for 45 minutes.
Add peanut butter and blend well.
Cook stew another 3 minutes, uncovered to blend.
Stir in chopped tomato and bell pepper.
Simmer 2-3 minutes, just until the vegetables soften but still retain shape.
Before serving, taste to correct seasonings; You may wish to add a final splash of lemon juice to refresh the flavors.

093fcaf5a6.gt:
Start by heating a medium-sized pot (you will cook everything in this pot) on medium heat, then add the oil.
Once oil comes to temperature, add cubed pork belly.
Cook pork belly, turning as it cooks, until all sides are browned.
Once pork is browned, add onions, garlic, and ginger.
Give a good stir, and continue to cook for about 3 minutes or so.
Add the shrimp paste.
Turn on your vent on high as this stuff has some funk (good funk), and continue to stir.
Toss in chilies, stir again, then add coconut milk.
Bring to a simmer and cook for about 1 hour, on low, stirring along the way.
Before serving, taste and season with salt or pepper.
Now you are ready to dig in.
I like to serve with a small bowl of rice to the side, along with a soup bowl of the Bicol Express.
This dish is rich, creamy, spicy, funky, and overall totally comforting and right up my alley.

d1d3e72257.gt:
Dice the tomato into 2-3 cm cubes.
Thinly slice the garlic.
Salt and pepper the cod.
Prep the shrimp.
Put the olive oil, red chili pepper, and garlic into a frying pan and saute over low heat.
Add the cod and cook both sides over medium heat.
Add the shrimp.
Quickly cook both sides, and add the water and tomatoes.
When it comes to a boil, simmer for 4 minutes over medium to high heat as you pour the broth over the fish.
Add the olive oil, and season with herb salt once the acqua pazza comes to a boil.
Dish it up, and scatter parsley on top.
d1d3e72257.pred:
place cod and shrimp in shallow dish.
 cover with marinar and marinate for 15 min.
 add swizz to fresh marinarda sauce.
 boil, steam or microwave skillet shrimp for about 2 min., until pink.
 drain and set aside.
 blend marinarre with oil and add to large saucepan with tomatoe, chili pepper and garlic.
 cook slowly for 7 min. on medium heat.
 stir in reserved marinaro sauce and water.
 bring to boil.
 reduce heat and simmer covered for 5 min.. add prawns.
 simmer covered until prawes turn pink.

7d493176df.gt:
In a large saucepot, combine the potatoes, coleslaw, carrots, and chicken stock.
Add 4 cups water; the liquid should barely cover the vegetables.
Bring to a boil, then cover halfway and reduce the heat to simmer until tender, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, whisk the beer and mustard.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to simmer and add the bratwurst.
Simmer gently until cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the bratwurst to the vegetable mixture; discard the beer mixture.
Divide the stew among dishes and serve with mustard.
7d493176df.pred:
roast the brats in a hot oven 200 degrees c for 1 to 2 hours.
 place all the ingredients for the slaw and beer mixture in crock pot.
 stir well, cover, and set on low for 5 to 6 hours.

6a4602be69.gt:
Mix all ingredients until smooth.
With a teaspoon, make little heaps (walnut-sized) on a floured and greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 300 degrees for 6-8 minutes.
You can also place 1/2 of a pecan on each cookie while still warm.
6a4602be69.pred:
preheat oven to 325f 180c.
 use a 9x9x2 inch baking pan and spray lightly with cooking spray.
 combine sugar and pudding mix in medium bowl.
 whisk in egg and melted chocolate until well blended.
 stir in condensated milk.
 add butter and 1 cup 150ml softened butter, melted in microwave and butter cooled.cook and stir over medium low heat until chocolate is melted and mixture is well blended and well blended,about 5 minutes.
 remove from heat and stir in the flour, vanilla and confectioners sugar.
 fold in nuts, almonds or chopped nut of your choice.
 spread batter into prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes.

6ae95ca0b8.gt:
Knead on a lightly floured surface, as little as possible.
Roll to 1/2 inch thickness.
Cut into desired shapes.
You can also drop by spoonful onto a cookie sheet and flatten slightly.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes at 450.
Note: Dried fruits or nuts can be added to batter if desired.
6ae95ca0b8.pred:
preheat the oven to 450 degrees. line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
 combine the all purpose and whole wheat pastry flour, baking powder, sugar, cream of tarlu, and salt. add the butter and rub it into the dry ingredients until it resembles coarse meal. if you ve cut the butter in pieces before adding it, it ll be easier to cut it into small pieces.
 make a well in the center of the dry ingredient mixture, pour the milk over it, and stir until the dough comes together, being careful not to overwork the dough.
 turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and knead it gently 5 6 times to smooth it out, then pat it into a 1/2 inch thick round. using a 3 inch biscuit cutter, cut out rounds and arrange them on the baking sheet, about 2 inches apart. bake until they re brown, about 20 minutes.

cbda115173.gt:
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook and stir ground beef and onion in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
Mix chili sauce, ketchup, water, pickle relish, brown sugar, and mustard into the ground beef mixture; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer until flavors are blended, about 15 minutes.
cbda115173.pred:
1. brown the beef. drain and return to pan.
 2. add the onion and stir until softened.
 3. stir in the remaining ingredients. reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
 4. smear on toast if desired, or on hamburger buns, and enjoy

70b786a095.gt:
Preheat the oven to gas 4 / 180C / 350F with and line 2 baking trays with foil and have 2 spare baking trays handy
Peel the beets and slice very thinly, 1/16 inch thick with a mandolin but be careful of your fingers.
In a large bowl, toss the sliced beets with the extra virgin olive oil
Arrange the beets in a single layer on each tray and sprinkle with a small amount of the salt.
You can use plain sea salt or any flavoured salt of preferrence.
Stack an extra baking tray on top of each layer of beetroot.
This keeps the crisps flat.
Put one tray on the oven top shelf and the other on the bottom
Bake until the edges of the beets begin to dry out, about 20 minutes.
Peek around 17 minutes to check!
Remove the extra trays that are on top of the beets and rotate the trays so the top one now goes in the bottom and the bottom one goes to the top
Bake a further 17 - 20 minutes.
Remove the crisps as they become lighter in color.
Transfer to a wire rack, they will crisp up as they cool
Keep in a lidded container for up to a week
70b786a095.pred:
preheat oven to 375 degrees.

 scrub beetops well, pat dry, and place them in a bowl. drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with minced and minced rosemary and ev salt. toss well to coat. spread beetos in an even layer on a baking sheet. bake for 45 minutes or until beeps have softened.

6f1343402a.gt:
Heat cumin seeds and mustard seed in hot dry skillet over high heat, swirling pan, until seeds start to pop.
Reduce heat to medium; add onions, chilies, and add a small amount of water; cook until onion is tender, adding more water as necessary to prevent sticking.
Add potatoes, ground cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt (to taste), and cayenne pepper, stirring to mix well.
Add 2/3 cup water, cover, reduce heat and cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until spices are absorbed and potatoes are tender.
Add a small amount of water at a time if all liquid evaporates.
Fold in cilantro just before serving.
6f1343402a.pred:
toast the cumin seeds and mustard seeds in a heavy pan over medium heat for two minutes, until they begin to pop.
 add the onion and saute until soft, about 3 minutes. add the mustard seeds and sautes for 1 minute.
 mix in the cilantro, parsley, lemon peel, serrano, potatoes, garlic, bell pepper, cloves and coriandander. saut over medium high heat for 10 minutes, stirring constantly.
 transfer to a bowl.
 combine the ground spices, cayene, and salt in jar and shake well. cut the beef short and thin into 1/3 inch wide pieces, and place in crockpot.
 pour the spice mixture over the meat, stirring gently and gently to coat.
 cover and cook on low 5 hours or on high 3 hours or until meat is tender. stir in cilantro just before serving.

91d53e8b2a.gt:
I would use my own brownie recipe but you can use a box mix.
Prepare the brownie mix as directed on package.
Pour into greased 13x9 baking pan.
Beat cream cheese with electric mixer on med.
speed until smooth.
Add sugar, mixing until blended.
Add egg and vanilla; mix just until blended.
Pour cream cheese mixture over brownie mixture; cut through batter with knife several times for marble effect.
Bake at 350F for 35 to 40 minutes or until cream cheese mixture is lightly browned.
Cool; cut into squares.
Note: Do not use brownie mixes that include syrup pouch.
91d53e8b2a.pred:
preheat oven to 350.
 prepare brownie batter as directed on box, pour into a greased 9 x 13 x 2 inch baking pan.
 cool.
 in mixer bowl beat cream cheese and instant coffee until smooth.
 add sugar, egg and vanilla.
 beat on medium speed until smooth, fold in whipped topping.
 pour cheese mixture over brownie.
 bake 25 30 minutes or until knife inserted into center comes out clean.
 do not overbake.
 for chocolate cheesecake, combine 1 8oz.
 box semi sweet chocolate chips and 1 tsp.
 each of cinnamon and ground cloves or 1/4 teaspoon each of baking powder and baking soda.
 stir in 1/2 tblsp baking soda and 1/4 t nutmeg to chocolate mixture.
 spread chocolate mixture over warm brownies.
 top with remaining cool whip.
 chill at least 3 hours.

7a6c6f2959.gt:
Dressing:.
Place the almonds and water into a blender or food proccesor and turn on high speed to puree.
Add remaining ingredients, except for oil, and run to blend and whip thoroughly.
With the motor running, slowly pour in oil and run until the dressing is thick and creamy.
(dressing can be prepared and refrigerated for up to 1 week.
).
As stated in the description, you may use 3/4 cup oil and 1/4 cup water or apple juice(or liquid of choice) and get a little thinner dressing.
Let sit for a few minutes to thicken up.
Salad:.
Put 1/2 cup of the dressing in the bottom of your salad bowl.
Add all ingredients, except lettuce, and toss to coat.
Serve:.
Put several lettuce leaves on each plate and add dressed salad.
Serve extra dressing on the side.
Enjoy!

e6bf3951b6.gt:
Cook meat and onion and green pepper until meat is browned and vegetables under tender.
Drain.
Stir in remaining ingredients and cover and simmer for 1 hour.
Remove Bay leaf when finished.
e6bf3951b6.pred:
brown beef in large dutch oven or pot over medium high heat.
 remove beef with slotted spoon, reserving 1 ol drippings in pan.
 return beef to pan. add onions, peppers, and lettuce.
 cook and stir until crisp tender.
 add remaining ingredients except cheese.
 bring to boil.
 reduce heat to low.
 simmer, uncovered, 30 min., stirring occasionally.
 stir in cheese. cover and simmer an additional 15 min.
 discard bay leaf before serving.

064cb6c3cf.gt:
In a large Dutch oven, cook green beans and ham on medium heat with water up just over the beans.
Cook for 20-30 minutes.
Add potatoes and salt, cover and turn heat down to low, cook another 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are done when pierced with a fork.
Note: Amount of ham and salt can be adjusted to your taste.

5e144fbd37.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Spread a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of a 9"x13" casserole.
Cover with a layer of noodles (3 or 4 noodles should be enough).
Place ricotta in a bowl and add about 1/4 cup of water, stirring until blended.
Spread 1/3 of this mixture over the pasta (you can use a cake spatula).
Spread 1/3 of the remaining pasta sauce over the cheese.
Spread 1/3 of the vegetables over the sauce.
Sprinkle 1/3 of the mozzarella over the veggies.
Repeat twice starting with the noodles and ending with the mozzarella.
Cover and bake until the noodles are tender (35 to 40 minutes).
Remove cover and bake 5 minutes until cheese starts to become golden.
Remove from oven and allow to stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.

9168e15a37.gt:
Heat 3 tablespoons of the olive oil in a heavy soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, and add the onions.
Cook, stirring, until very tender, about eight minutes.
Add a pinch of salt and the garlic, and stir for another minute or so until fragrant.
Stir in the tomatoes, with their liquid, and bring to a simmer.
Simmer about eight minutes until cooked down and fragrant, and add the cauliflower to the pot.
Stir together, and add the bay leaf, rosemary, pepper, dissolved tomato paste and wine.
Bring to a simmer, and add salt to taste.
Cover, reduce the heat and simmer 30 to 40 minutes until the cauliflower is very tender.
Stir in the olives and vinegar if using, and adjust salt and pepper.
Remove from the heat, and stir in the remaining olive oil.
Serve hot or warm.

feb5ca6df3.gt:
Brown sausage in a medium skillet over medium high heat, stirring to break apart.
Drain, and place in a bowl.
Stir in softened cream cheese, drained sauerkraut, and mustard until thoroughly combined.
Cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place beaten eggs and crushed crackers in separate bowls.
Roll sausage mixture into small balls and dip first into egg, then roll in cracker crumbs to coat.
Arrange on a sheet pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, turning once for even browning.
Serve warm.
feb5ca6df3.pred:
combine first 7 ingredients in large skillet, stir well. bring to a boil. reduce heat, simmer uncovered 5 minutes. transfer sausage mixture to ungreased 9 inch round cake pan or deep dish pie plate.
 combine remaining ingredients, stir until well blended. spread mixture evenly over sausage mixture in pan.
 bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden. remove from oven, and spread topping evenly over casserole, if desired. return to oven, bake 15 minutes or just until topping is set.
 preheat oven to 350 degrees. bake casserole uncovered for 45 to 50 minutes or till bubbly.

 makes 6 servings.
 serving size 1/2 cup.

ffd5e1942a.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F. Spray an 8x8 baking pan with cooking spray and set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together cream cheese and butter until light and fluffy with a electric hand mixer.
Add in egg and cake mix and beat until combined.
Fold in white chocolate chips and sprinkles.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until bars turn golden brown.
Remove from oven and let them cool completely.
Cut into bars and serve.
Enjoy!
Note: Funfetti cake batter bars will keep covered for about five days.
ffd5e1942a.pred:
preheat oven to 375f.
 in large bowl, using mixer, beat cream cheese and butter until blended.
 beat in mini morsels and honey.
 add egg and stir until blended blend in food coloring.
 cover bowl with plastic wrap refrigerate 15 minutes.
 place coffee cream cheese mixture in bowl whisk in water until smooth.
 gradually add muffin mix to cream cheese batter.
 fold in food color until blended
 to make each dip, using 1/3 cup cream cheese mix, cut each cake into 3 inch squares arrange on baking sheets lined with parchment paper.
 to bake, spoon 1/2 teaspoon coffee creamers over each dip and spread evenly.
 bake 7 to 10 minutes or until tops are golden brown, centers are almost set.
 cool completely.
 dip
 in food colouring, melt chocolate chips in top of double boiler set over hot water.
 assemble dippers by placing 2 squares on each dessert plate.
 repeat with remaining dough and coffee creamerin.
 garnish, if desired, with chocolate sprinkles.
 serve warm.
 store leftovers in refrigerator.

c089da7346.gt:
In a food processor or blender, blend berries and sugar until completely pureed, about 5 minutes.
Scrape mixture into a 9 -x-9" loaf pan and freeze until solid, at least 4 hours.
c089da7346.pred:
mix fruit peck and peccles in large bowl.
 add sugar and fruit peeces,stir until well coated.
 let stand 20 min,bring to boil, reduce heat,stimble till jam is thick and bubbling.
 skim off any foam and skim.
 pour into hot, sterilized jars.
 cover with lids,cover.
 process in water bath 10 min or canner in boiling water bath.

ed226be03e.gt:
Heat oil in a small frying pan over low heat until hot, about 1 minute.
Add chile flakes and remove from heat.
Let cool to room temperature.
Strain through a fine mesh strainer if desired, then transfer to a container and cover until ready to use.
Heat half of a gas or charcoal grill to high (about 400 degrees F) and the other half to low (about 300 degrees F).
Divide dough in 1/2 and roll into 2 rounds about 1/4 inch thick and 10 inches in diameter.
Brush the top of 1 round with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Lay dough oiled side down on the hotter half of the grill and brush the top with oil and sprinkle with salt.
Grill without moving until grill marks form on the bottom of the dough, about 2 minutes.
Flip dough with a spatula or tongs to the cooler half of grill.
Spread 1/2 of the sauce evenly over the dough, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the Parmesan cheese over the sauce, then top with 1/2 of the peppers, 1/2 of the sausage, and 1/2 of the mozzarella.
Cover and grill, rotating if necessary to avoid any hot spots, until dough is lightly charred and cheese is melted, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Transfer pizza to a cutting board, sprinkle 1 tablespoon more of the Parmesan over top, drizzle with desired amount of chile oil, slice, and serve.
Repeat with second round of dough and remaining toppings.
ed226be03e.pred:
preheat the oven to 450 degrees f.
 grease 2 large baking sheets with 2 tablespoon of the olive oil.
 roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface until approximately 1/8 inch thick.
 the dough should be very thin.
 make a small hole in the middle of the dough and spread the olive and red chilly flakes all over the surface.
 brush the dough evenly with the oil and arrange it on the prepared baking sheets.
 use your fingers to gently press down on the dough so the oil runs evenly across the entire surface. it will be about 1/2 inch thick and about 1 1/2 inches deep.
 if any oil is remaining, cover the entire bottom of the baking sheet with more oil and cover with the remaining dough.
 bake until the crust is golden brown, about 14 to 16 minutes.
 remove the dough from the oven and brush lightly with oil. return the pizza to the oven. bake, uncovered, for another 12 to 15 minutes, until the surface of the pizza is firm.
 for the toppings
 while the crust bakes, heat the remaining olive oil in a medium saucepan

4ff0a3ff39.gt:
In a large bowl, combine flour, granulated sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
Make a well in the center of flour mixture.
In medium bowl, combine egg, buttermilk, orange juice concentrate and melted butter; add all at once to flour mixture.
Stir just until moistened (batter should be lumpy).
Fold in walnuts.
Line twelve 2-1/2-inch muffin cups with paper bake cups.
Fill the cups 3/4 full with batter.
Bake in a 400 degree F. oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until muffins are golden.
Remove the muffins from the pans.
In a small bowl, combine powdered sugar, orange peel and enough orange juice (2 to 3 teaspoons) to make a drizzling consistency.
Drizzle over warm muffins.
4ff0a3ff39.pred:
preheat the oven to 400 degrees. line the bottom of standard 12 cup muffin pan with paper liners or grease each cup.

 in large mixing bowl, combine the flour, granola, baking soda, tumeric, baking powder, and salt. in small bowl, whisk together the egg, buttermilk, and orange juice. add the liquid ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring just until moist. do not over mix. add more buttermilk if needed. don t overmix or your muffins will be tough. set aside.
 stir together butter and 1/4 cup orange juice in small mixing bowl. stir in walnuts.
 spoon the batter into the prepared pan. spread batter as thinly as you can, almost to the top. bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. cool in the pan for five minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
 meanwhile, make the icing in a small mixing mixing bowl combine the powdere sugar, sugar, remaining orange peel, baking power, and a pinch of salt. stir vigorously to blend. if too thick, add a little orange juice until it reaches desired consistency. ice the muffins with the frosted icting.

84fd3c9208.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees, cut top off of squash and remove pulp and seeds, place upside down on cookie sheet and fill pan 1/2 way up with water, cover with foil and bake 45 minutes, remove and make sure it is fork tender, if not continue cooking in 10 minute intervals, leave on pan to cool.
While it is baking, in rice cooker cook rice with 2 cups vegetable broth, diced zucchini, 1 diced carrot, chopped parsley, and about 1/2 cup water.
When rice is done cooking, stir it well and add the raw tomato, pepper and 1/2 of the onion diced.
In a Large skillet add olive oil and brown 1/2 of the diced onion, when brown add the ground turkey, sage, garlic and mushrooms -- continue cooking until meat is done -- add the rice mixture to the meat mixture and stir well, use the remaining vegetable broth to deglaze pan and get moisture level up for oven baking.
Remove about 3/4 of the squash meat and puree for pie or freeze for later use.
Fill squash with the rice/meat mixture about 1/2 full then add 1/2 the cheese, then layer remaining rice mixture on top and top it all with the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes just to get the cheese melted and the flavors melded.
Makes a great presentation to the table with the squash full of the meal!

d069fb1925.gt:
Cut off the stem of the shiitake mushrooms and cut into bite size pieces.
Put water and the seasoning ingredients in a pot and let it boil.
Then, add the shiitake mushrooms, cover with a drop lid, and cook it for about 10 minutes on low heat.
Stir the pot sometimes.
Take off the drop lid when the liquid boils down and remove from the heat when the liquid has almost gone.
When it has cooled down a little, it is done.
You can keep it in the fridge for about 3 days so make some and keep it for bento lunch box.
It will be an extra dish for dinner if you keep some in the fridge.
d069fb1925.pred:
note for an authentic japanese style terapia version, use a tuscan style omuriced gratin dish, such as a daikon radish.
 for a spicy version, cook 1 cup finely diced omuscan shishitake mushrooms with 2 teaspoon sugar in a few tablespoons water for 1 minute.
 add ginger and saute for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
 if you want to add salt and pepper, add it now.
 pour the mixture into the gratine dish and bake in 450f 230c oven for 1 hour.
 remove from oven and place under broiler until golden.
 serve warm with steamed rice.

fda9c36818.gt:
Put all of the ingredients in a jar for the dressing and shake to mix throughly.
That's all.
It keeps up to 1 week.
Thinly cut daikon radish into match sticks.
Add sliced onions.
Wakame seaweed.
Pour the dressing over the salad.
Daikon radish & carrot with crispy boiled and chirimen jako salad.The combination is great.
I found this salad dressing container at a 100 yen shop.
Perfect for storing liquids!
Cheap and convenient!
Just put all the ingredients to shake it up.
fda9c36818.pred:
in a large blender, combine soy, sesam sesam oil, chili sauce, chili, wine vinegar, seseeds, sugar, and mirin/soy. blend on high for a few seconds or until sugar is dissolved.
 taste and adjust seasoning. refrigerate for 2 hours, or overnight, then shake well to mix well before using.
 makes about 4 1/2 cups.

292b683c3f.gt:
Blend ice first just a tad.
Then add your milk, hot coffee(don't worry it won't melt anything that much at all.
), oreos and everything else.
Blend for about 1 minute and a half and pour it in a glass.
Enjoy guys.
Please don't get mad if u don't like it.
I was just experimenting and it actually came out pretty good.
Wish I had whipped cream and syrup or it'd be amazing.
I had no heavy cream so I couldn't make it..
If u don't like it though just make whatever changes or additions you feel and tell me what u did and post ur pics.
Thank u all.
Some people may add more oreos or sweetener.
That's up to u. I ran out of my sugar syrup so I didn't add any sugar.
Enjoy everyone.
292b683c3f.pred:
put your oreofas into a large pitcher. add cocotin, cinnamon, vanilla and extra peppermint extract, coffee extract, and cinnamon.

 measure your ice and put it in a mug.
 now begin pouring your coffee into the mug, about 1/2 the amount, until you reach the rim.
 using a fork, whip up your orzo with the milk or milk and coffee if used. add in your orezo and mix it in.
 add the ice to your cup and stir it in with the oreza. take your mug and pour in your mix/flavor. do not dribble this on you and keep stirring them in. when you get to the brim, give your mix some good stirs.
 finally, put your coffee on top of the orza. a good sprinkle of ground cinnamon and a pinch of nutmeg.
 this a yummy homemade coffee.

d859113e86.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Grease and flour a loaf pan and set aside.
Combine the eggs, oil, pumpkin and water in a large bowl.
Sift the dry ingredients together and stir into the pumpkin mixture.
Stir in walnuts.
Pour into the prepared loaf pan and bake for one hour or until a tester inserted near the center comes out clean.
d859113e86.pred:
in a bowl, beat together egg, oil, pumpkin and butter. then add water and stir until smooth.
 in another bowl combine the flour, 3/8 cup sugar, salt, tumeric, cinnamon, baking soda and mix.
 add this mixture to the pumpkin mixture and mix well. if it seems a little dry, add more butter or oil and mix till smooth. knead for 1 minute, then sprinkle the ground walnuts on top of the batter..
 coat a baking sheet with cooking spray or dip a spoon in melted butter, then use it to drop batter by 1/2 cup measure, then flatten into 6 inch circles, about 4 inches apart.
 bake for 8 to 10 minutes in 450 degree f oven or until the donut springs back when touched with a fingertip.
 donut bakes quickly, so keep an eye on them.
 remove and let cool.
 store in airtight container.
 makes 36.

dafbe725ac.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
Mix ingredients well in the order given.
Drop by teaspoon on cookie sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.
Under bake for a chewy cookie.
dafbe725ac.pred:
1.preheat oven to 350f.
 2.set aside a 1/3 cup of the flour. in a large bowl, cream the butter and sugars until fluffy, about 4 minutes.
 3.sift the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt together into another bowl. add the white sugar and beat the mixture until light and fluffy. then add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. add vanilla, raisins, coconut, and whole wheat flakes to the butter mixture, continuing to beat until blended. slowly mix in the flour mixture, blending well after addition. the dough will be stiff but it will come together nicely. drop by rounded spoonfuls onto a baking sheet. bake for 15 to 18 minutes. cool on wire racks.

 recipe recipe adapted from alton brown.

c7ae046d51.gt:
Place buttermilk, butter or margarine, sugar, salt, flour, whole wheat flour, and yeast into pan of bread machine.
Bake on White Bread setting.
Cool on wire racks before slicing.
c7ae046d51.pred:
pour buttermilk into bread machine pan in the order suggested by the manufacturer, then add margarines, sugar, salt, flours and yeast.
 select sweet cycle and set timer for 2 minutes.
 check dough after 2 minutes, adding more flour by the tablespoon if necessary.
 dough should be smooth and elastic not too sticky.
 punch down dough, then divide in half.
 form into loaves or rolls and place in lightly greased 9 1/2x5 1/2x3 inch loaf pans, cover pans and let rise until light and doubled, about 1 hour.
 meanwhile, preheat oven to 375f 190c.

491516b698.gt:
peel banana and cut off ends.
slice banana diagonally so u get oval shaped pieces.
u need 12 slices.
thickness to ur liking.
arange 4 banana slices on a plate.
two on two.
top two pointing upwards and bottom two pointing downward.
they should touch in the middle( it should resemble butterfly wings or a four leaf clover)
arrange 4 dried cranberries in the middle of the wings going up and down.
this is the body.
arrange 3 raisins on top wins and 2 raisins on bottom wings.
take the icing or gel and make 2 long feelers coming out of the top half of the dried cranberry.
repeat with rest of ingredients.
feel free to exsperiment wih different fruits.
good ones to work with are (strawberries, kiwi for the wings) pieces pineapple, chocolate chips, for decorating the wings (pretzel sticks or almond slivers for the feelers) get creative with the kids and have fun!
enjoy!
:)
makes 3 butterflies
491516b698.pred:
slice the banana into approximately 1/2 inch slices.
 coat the inside of an 8 inch bowl with tea tree and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of tea tree ingredients.
 in the bowl, add 1 tablespoon of crainberries to the soaked and drained half half.
 sprinkle the dried fruit into the banana.
 fill the remaining half with water.
 pour the remaining cranianberries and half andhalf into a small heatproof dish.
 place into microwave and heat for 30 seconds.
 remove and pour the melted fruit over the bananas.
 cover with plastic wrap and place in the microwave for 20 seconds. remove from microwave and spread the mixture out on the plastic wrap.
 then top with the remaining plastic wrap, ensuring that they form a neat shape.
 let rest in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
 if you make this with a microwave, place the bowl in the center of your microwave on high for about 10 seconds. if not, continue to cook for another 15 seconds or until the desired texture.
 use a toothpick to draw shapes on the banana and place the icling or writing back onto the banana by the end of the i use the writing i like and do not use the paper liners.
 enjoy

c2277ff083.gt:
In a large pot, bring the water and salt to a boil; add the lentils, reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 30 minutes or until the lentils are tender but not overcooked; drain.
In a colander, rinse the cooked lentils under cold water until slightly cool, then place them in a bowl.
Whisk together the remaining ingredients; pour over the lentils and combine well.
Chill for 1 to 2 hours and serve cold.
c2277ff083.pred:
combine 4 cups of the water and the salt in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
 add the lentils and return to resealable plastic bag. squeeze the air out of the bag and seal the bag.
 let the contents sit for 5 minutes.
 remove the lentil package from the refrigerator and let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. the water will begin to solidify during this time.
 discard any leftover liquid.
 while the lentil rinses, place the tuna in lrg nonstick skillet. cook over med high heat until it begins to sizzle, about 30 seconds. flip the fish and cook on the other side until golden brown, about 15 seconds. transfer to sm bowl and set aside.
 in med bowl, whisk together the olive oil, white wine, cumin, coriandan, cayene, and salt. pour the dressing over the tunisian tuna.
 toss to coat.
 divide the lentil mix between 4 dinner plates and then divide the fried seaweed around the top of each salad.
 drizzle each salad with some of the chile dressing and garnish with mint and snipped fresh mint.
 serve immediately.

3ac2a22c5f.gt:
Throughly mix together all ingredients.
Spoon sauce over meatloaf.
Bake for one hour at 350F.
For vegan, omit the Worcestershire sauce and use vegan alternative.

1ebd581dca.gt:
In a large mixing bowl combine rhubarb, strawberries, sugar, lemon juice, cornstarch and the pinch of salt, stirring together well.
Spoon mixture into an 8x8 in (20x20 cm) glass baking dish.
In a second bowl, combine brown sugar, oats, cinnamon, nutmeg and butter, and stir with a fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle this mixture over the fruit mixture.
If using oven, place in a 325F preheated oven, and bake uncovered for 20-25 minutes until golden brown on top and fruit is tender.
If using an outdoor grill, position the pan on a cool side of the grill (that means for a gas grill no heat directly underneath).
Maintain the heat to a medium-low temperature (around 300F).
Close lid of grill and cook 25-30 minutes.
Make sure to rotate the baking dish on the grill about every 8 minutes for even cooking.
Either way, the fruit should be tender and the juices bubbling when finished cooking.
I love serving with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or frozen yogurt.

1d309c893f.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken, soup, cheese, milk, salt, pepper and butter.
Mix together and pour mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 5 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly, and casserole is hot in the center.
1d309c893f.pred:
place the penne in a microwave safe dish and pour 2 cups of boiling water over it. cover and cook in the microwave on full power until tender. set aside.
 combine the undiluted soup and milk in crockpot. add the cooked spaghetti, chicken and all but 1/4 cup of the cheese. mix well to combine. season with salt and pepper. cook on low until tender, 4 to 6 hours. stir in the butter. sprinkle with remaining cheese. serve.

b4e4245834.gt:
Slice bananas and lay them out on cookie sheets, put into freezer for about 2 hours.
Take them from the freezer to your food processor or blender and blend them up, stopping every few min or so to scrap the sides down.
It does take a lil while but once it reaches the creaminess u like you can serve it as is and it will be more like a custard or put into a container and put into freezer til nice and thick like ice cream.
Update: If planning to keep this for a few days or so add a crushed vitamin C tablet and give it a good stir!
That's it!!!
Enjoy!!
!
b4e4245834.pred:
combine banana slices in blender.
 add enough water to cover banana slices.
 blend for 30 to 40 seconds or until very smooth.
 makes 4 1 cup servings.

6a6db8c9e3.gt:
trim away middle of bun
put 1 Cheddar cheese and 1tbsp of jam
add 3 hazelnut on each bun and bake 180 C for 5 minute till cheese melted
6a6db8c9e3.pred:
preheat your oven to 400.
 take two 9x5 loaf pans and lay out a piece of non stick aluminum foil.
 place a loaf pan and 1 bun on top of that.
 once you re done cutting, spray the bottom of the pans with a non stick spray, and place it in the oven.
 for mini bun minis, cut one of your mini bun buns in half and set aside for the top.
 if you d like a little bit of more of your favourite, wrap half of that bun in aluminum foil to help you keep your fried cheeses from sticking together.

6f4d1ffc76.gt:
In la deep pot, bring water, a pinch of salt and oil to a boil.
Rinse rice a couple of times.
Add to boiling water.
Reduce heat to low, cover and cook until water evaporates (1520 minutes).
Fluff with fork, let it cool to room temperature or refrigerate until ready to use.
When ready to serve, add chopped cilantro and lime juice.
Season with salt.
6f4d1ffc76.pred:
in a small saucepan, combine broth powder with water and bring to a boil.
 reduce heat to low, then simmer uncovered, for 3 minutes.
 remove from heat and set aside.
 in frying pan, heat oil over medium heat.
 add rice, ginger paste, ground jasmin, and spices, stirring constantly for 5 to 6 minutes, until rice has toasted and spices are fragrant.
 stir in cooked chicken broth.
 place lid on pan, turn heat down to medium low, and simmer until the liquid has been absorbed, about 5 minutes.

c7e9cae7ae.gt:
In a large saucepan with boiling salted water, cook pasta 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente.
Drain and put back in the saucepan.
Meanwhile, in another saucepan, bring to boil heavy cream and dry onion flakes.
Add asparagus and smoked salmon, cook at low heat until warm.
Remove from the heat, add 1/2 cup of parmigiano reggiano and stir.
Add salt and pepper.
Add sauce to the pasta and stir to coat well.
Sprinkle each serving with remaining parmigiano reggiano.
c7e9cae7ae.pred:
in a large saucepan, over low heat, bring 4 qts water to a boil. add the ling noodle and cook as directed. reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water, drain the nilapio, and break it into 2 inch pieces. meanwhile, heat the cream in frying pan, and simmer for 5 minutes. add onion, tamari and salmon, and cook over medium high heat 2 minutes. combine with the drained pasta, add a little of the reserved water if needed, add grated cheeses, and mix well.

 stir in chowder and season with salt and hot pepper. plate the pasta and top with shredded cheddar and a dollop of roquefort.

1690800ec2.gt:
Peel and quarter the potatoes, then wash them thoroughly.
Place the potatoes in a large pot with enough cold, salted water to cover them and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 min, or until cooked through, and drain.
Meanwhile put butter, lemon and garlic in a saucepan over very, very low.
Let it simmer for 20-30 minutes.
Discard lemon and garlic.
When potatoes are done, drain and mashed to your liking.
Fold in avocado and butter.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
If you like creamer mashed potatoes, you can add some milk.
1690800ec2.pred:
mashed the potatoes into a thick pancake mix.
 mix all the other ingredients together and season with salt and peppper.
 fry the pancakes in a non stick pan until golden, flip over and cook on both sides till done.
 top with your favorite sour cream or tartar sauce.

4a46bab1e9.gt:
Mix all ingredients together, I use my stand mixer with the dough hook.
Let mixer kneed the dough for about 5 minutes.
Dough should be moist and pliable but not sticky, if it is dry add more water, if it is too sticky add a little extra flour.
Coat a bowl with a little oil place dough in the bowl and cover with cling wrap and leave for about 1 hour or till doubled in size.
Once doubled in size dust bench lightly with flour turn out dough and lightly press down to remove a little of the air.
Form into your choice of loaf, I like to use a proofing basket, but you could use a tin or free form.
Let the loaf rise for another 40 min to 1 hour.
Pre heat your oven to super hot 450 F/ 250C.
I use a pizza stone but it can go straight in the oven on a tray if you don't have one.
Leave oven temp on high for 10 min then reduce to 375 F/ 190 C for a further 20 minute.
Enjoy!
4a46bab1e9.pred:
place the flours in the pan of your bread machine in the order recommended by the manufacturer.
 set the bread machine to the bread cycle, or start the bread dough cycle.
 if the dough is too dry or sticky add some flour or water as necessary.
 you should be able to see the dough s lightness when the machine is done.
 at the end of the first cycle, remove the dough from the pan, and form it into a ball.
 place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and allow it to rise until it almost doubles in size.
 this will take about 1 hour.
 when you are ready to bake the bread, cut the dough into 4 equal pieces.
 using a bench scraper, punch down the dough, and shape each piece into ten inch balls.
 transfer the balls to 2 lightly sprayed 8 by 4 inch loaf pans, making sure that the seam side is up.
 cover with a dish towel or plastic wrap.
 allow the dough to rise for 15 minutes.
 in oiled food processor, combine the yeast, honey, salt and greek olive oil and process until blended and smooth.
 let sit at room temperature until creamy and the honey has dissolved.
 whisk the yogurt and lemongrass in med.
 bowl.
 add the yogurt mixture.
 the mixture will be very soft.
 pour the lemongrass and juice mixture over the risen dough.
 turn

3ffc1f8ead.gt:
Follow instructions on pizza crust package
After flattening the mix on round cookie sheet, add the pasta sauce in circular motions starting from middle with spoon (leaving 2 inches on the outer ring for crust)
Add the cheese evenly across sauce
Add the pepperoni
Cook for 10-14 minutes or until crust is golden brown
3ffc1f8ead.pred:
preheat oven to 450 f.
 place pasta sauce, 1/4 cup cheese and seasonings in medium saucepan. cook and stir over medium heat until heated through.
 spread pizza crust on greased 10 inch pizza pan or baking sheet. top crust with meat if desired. sprinkle remaining cheese and italian seasoning.
 bake 14 17 minutes or until crust is golden brown. remove from oven. let stand 5 minutes. cut into servings.

cab917403f.gt:
Mix all ingredients together and place in a clean jar with a tight lid.
Use 2 T.
per pound of meat.
cab917403f.pred:
mix all ingredients in a large bowl.
 store in an air tight container. makes about 3 cups.
 this will keep 1 to 2 months in the refrigerator.
 enjoy.
 for the spicy flavor add 1 teaspoons of cayenne pepper to the above recipe. add 1 to 3 teaspoon to taste.

fefd0facd1.gt:
Trim the bottoms of the asparagus and place in a shallow dish.
Pour the olive oil, salt, pepper and lime juice over the asparagus and toss well to coat thoroughly.
Grill over hot coals for 2 to 3 minutes, or until tender.
Serve immediately.
fefd0facd1.pred:
preheat oven to 475 f.
 cut asparagus into 1 inch pieces. toss in olive oil, salt, and pepper until coated. place on a lightly greased baking sheet and roast for 8 10 minutes, or until tender.
 while asparagus is roasting, whisk together sassafras and lime juice. to serve, spoon sambal oelek over asparagus and serve.

b4611b4385.gt:
Heat should be medium-high and rack about 4 inches from fire.
Put shrimp and garlic in a food processor and pulse until just chopped; remove to a large bowl.
Working in batches, grind pork fat until just chopped (be careful not to overprocess).
Add to bowl.
Then grind meat until just chopped, again being careful not to overprocess; add to bowl.
Mix shrimp, pork fat and meat with soy sauce, scallions, cilantro, chili and ginger; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Shape into 8 patties.
Grill about 4 minutes, then turn and cook for a total of 8 to 10 minutes, or until nicely browned and cooked through.
Garnish with scallions, cilantro, cabbage and pickled pepper, to taste.
b4611b4385.pred:
using a small spoon or a teaspoon measure, scoop out the meat from the shell and set aside. then, with a large spoon, scoop the meat and shell into a bowl and discard.
 mix with the mashed onion and garlic and set the bowl aside.

 put the shrimp in teflex bowl with sanding water to cover in which you ll cook the shrimp. let stand until shrimp are pink, about 5 minutes.
 using your fingers, split a 2 inch opening in the back of each shrimp.
 place 3 shrimp in each opening with the skin on.
 fill with 3 cup of the soup

0787add592.gt:
Fry the egg and season with salt and pepper.
Add all other ingredients to a bowl and top with warm egg.
Drizzle with balsamic syrup.
0787add592.pred:
prepare first four ingredients and place in salad bowl.
 combine first four ingredients.
 add a portion of shredded lettuce to each serving bowl.
 divide salad between each bowl, adding remaining shredded lettuce to each bowl.
 garnish each serving with sliced grape tomato and sprinkle with grated cheese.

a777a9be09.gt:
In a wide mouth 1 quart jar, layer the barley, peas, rice and lentils.
Then layer around the edges the onion, parsley, salt, lemon pepper, bouillon and the alphabet pasta.
Fill the rest of the jar with the twist macaroni.
Seal and attach a gift card.
The gift card should read: Add contents of jar to 3 quarts of water, 2 stalks of chopped celery, 2 sliced carrots, 1 cup of shredded cabbage (optional) and 2 cups diced tomatoes.
Over medium low heat, cover and simmer about 1 hour, or until vegetables are tender.
a777a9be09.pred:
in a large container or food processor, combine the barley, split peeled pea and rice.
 cover and let soak overnight in cold water.
 the next day, drain and rinse the dry lentil and the red peppers.
 in jar with tight fitting lid, combine all the ingredients.
 set aside for two to three days.
 bring to room temperature before serving.
 stir.
 makes 24 servings

f7ca0c32fa.gt:
Place greens on serving plate.
Top with chicken and corn.
Drizzle with salsa, then dressing.
f7ca0c32fa.pred:
combine all ingredients in a large salad bowl.
 toss well and serve immediately.
 use more sun maiden fusion if you d like this to be more spicy.

4aec361465.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F. Put the chickpeas into a bowl.
Coat the chickpeas with the olive oil, garlic powder and whichever spice you prefer.
Place on a sheet pan that youve lined with parchment paper and roast at 400 F for approximately 20 minutes.
Toss in the fresh chives, adjust the seasoning as needed and serve.
If you choose to saute them on the stovetop, use a cast iron or aluminum pan on medium heat and stir frequently for approximately 15-20 minutes.
4aec361465.pred: heat the oil in the bottom of med sized frying pan over med heat, add the garlic and saute, don t let it color, if you see it burning add the kalamatas or the sassafra, the chili and the chopped onions or greens, then stir fry for 5 or 6 minutes. add the chopped tomatoes, chick or garbanzo beans, and the seasoning, and stir fry until all the ingredients are heated through and the mixture begins to dry up

524529d38b.gt:
Add ingredients (except for cornmeal) to machine bread pan in order as per manufacturer's instructions.
Set to "Dough" cycle.
Lightly grease one 9 x 13-inch pan and sprinkle with cornmeal.
When the dough cycle is complete, roll out dough and place in pan.
Let rest in pans for 10-15 minutes.
Add toppings of your choice.
Bake at 350F until done (approximately 20 minutes, depending on the thickness of toppings).
I make the pizza in 9x13 rectangular pans rather than the round pizza pans, because the squares pieces are easier to reheat and pack in school lunches.
524529d38b.pred:
add all the ingredients, except the yeast, in the order suggested by your bread machine.

 set on the dough cycle for basic bread setting.

3ba549830f.gt:
Mix sauce, peppers and walnuts in saucepan; cook on medium heat until heated through, stirring occasionally.
Pour over hot ravioli in large serving bowl; toss to coat.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley, if desired.
3ba549830f.pred:
cook the pasta according to the directions on package. drain.

 in a large mixing bowl, combine all the ingredients except the tomato slices. fold in the tomatoes and spread 1/4 cup of the mixture evenly over the bottom of a 6 cup. teflon or ceramic 8 x 8 baking dish. top with 1 cup of tomato slices and 1 1/4 cups of cheese. repeat with the remaining ingredients, ending with mozzarella and remaining cheese.
 bake in 375 f oven for 15 to 20 minutes until heated through and the topping is golden brown.

05096fc3ad.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Coat a standard (12 cup) muffin tin with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, whisk egg whites, sugar, cocoa and salt until combined.
Add coconut; mix until well coated.
***I would add the sliced almonds in at this point with the coconut.
They didn't want to stick to the tops of the cookies!
***.
Dividing evenly, spoon mixture into muffin tin and pat in gently with moistened fingers.
Sprinkle with almonds and pat on gently.
***See note above***.
Bake until almonds are golden, 20-25 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool in tin for 5-10 minutes.
Run a thin metal spatula around the edges to loosen from pan.
Turn out onto rack to cool completely.
Cookies keep in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.
05096fc3ad.pred:
preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
 place the egg whites in a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment.
 beat on high speed until soft peaks form.
 add the sugar and cocoa powder.
 whip on medium high speed until stiff peaks form.
 fold the coconut and almonds into the egg whites.
 drop the batter by level tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing 2 inches apart.
 bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the cookie edges are set and the tops are cracked.
 let cool for 3 minutes on the baking sheet before removing.

d75096ee18.gt:
place a small pot on medium heat and add heavy cream.
Bring to a low boil.
Pour over chocolate chips and mix until thoroughly melted.
Add in butter and vanilla extract.
d75096ee18.pred:
1. place the chocolate chips in a bowl. in drame sized cups, stir together the eavespray and the heavy cream. cook on high until boiling, stirring constantly and shaking the cups until the mixture boils again. remove from heat and immediately add the butter flavor and the vanilla extract, stirring until smooth. cool.

 2. spread the chocolate mixture into a waxed or parchment lined 8 inch square pan. chill in the refrigerator for about 2 hours to set. the fae, also called melting chocolate, should have an absorbent consistency.

61afcadcb1.gt:
1.
In a small bowl, combine almonds and brown sugar; set aside.
2.
In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Beat in the almond extract.
3.
Combine flour, baking soda and baking powder.
Add this to the creamed mixture alternately with bananas and sour cream.
Fold in the vanilla or white chips.
4.
Spread into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking pan.
Sprinkle with reserved almond and brown sugar mixture.
5.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.
61afcadcb1.pred:
preheat the oven to 350f 180c.
 in lrg bowl, whisk together the toasted ground almonds and sugar.
 work in the melted butter until the mixture resembles coarse, textured cornmeal.
 press the mixture into a 10 inch 23 cm springform pan, reserving 1/4 cup of

5045cde8e5.gt:
Desand the clams.
Boil the water and add the dashi.
Add the clams.
Once the shells have opened up, add the ingredients.
Garnish with mitsuba or thin green onion and it's done!

07f2c36b9b.gt:
Heat bacon for 30 seconds in the microwave between two pieces of paper towel to soak up excess grease
Spread honey mustard on tortilla then lay cheese on top of honey mustard, then add chicken, then add the bacon.
Spread the guacamole on top of the bacon then lay lettuce leaves on top of guacamole
Roll up and devour!
07f2c36b9b.pred:
in a large skillet on medium heat cook and stir bacon until crispy.
 remove from skillet. drain.
 add chicken to pan, cook and stir about five minutes or until thoroughly heated.
 prepare hot dill pickles per instructions,.
 while chicken is cooking, take a large tortilla. sprinkle cheese on tortilla then add chicken and bacon.
 fold in 1 sides of tortilla.
 in a small bowl or container, add butter lettuce, mustard, pickles, and cheese, blend well.
 if you are using larger tortilla chips, place it in the microwave for 15 seconds and then gently roll up.
 let rest on serving plate until ready to serve.

a5230cef43.gt:
With and Electric mixer, beat butter & Icing sugar until it stands up like egg whites.
In a seperate medium bowl, combine flour and corn starch.
Add slowly to butter and icing sugar mixture.
(I find when your mixer starts to power out, then use a wooden spoon to take over, but please try to use the mixer as long as possible).
Drop from teaspoon onto cookie sheet about 2 inches apart.
Top cookies with jub-jubs, bar cherries, or anything really.
My oldest son loves smarties on his.
Imagination is up to you.
Bake at 300 for approx 30 minutes until bottom edges turn a light brown.
(Because all ovens vary please start checking them at about 20-25 minutes).
a5230cef43.pred:
1.
 cream butter with a margarine.
 add in sugar, vanilla, and vanilla.
 beat for 2 min till light and fluffy.
 2.
 add apricots and stir.
 mix in cornstarch.
 3.
 stir naan crusts into 1 1 ratio with flour/almond extract.
 4.
 divide dough into 4 parts forming disks.
 wrap in waxed paper and chill for 30 min.
 5.
 preheat oven to 350 degrees.
 6.
 roll out 1 disk dough to 1/8 thickness on a well floured board.
 7 cut into 4 1/2 circle cookies or 1 circles if you re in a hurry.
 8.
 place on parchment lined baking sheets, arranging them about 1 1/2 apart.
 9.
 bake for 10 12 min or possibly till they start to brown a bit.
 10.
 let stand 2 min on sheet before moving to wire racks to cold completely.

02b1542927.gt:
Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced.
line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place thighs on a work surface, open out and generously spread tapenade inside each.
Fold fillets back into shape.
Cut pastry sheets in half.
Place chicken at one end of the sheet fold edges in, fold pastry over chicken and roll to make a neat parcel.
Pinch sides to seal.
Place, seam-side down, on a prepared tray.
Brush with egg to glaze.
Sprinkle with basil.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and pastry is golden brown.
Serve with vegetables.

b067e71075.gt:
Heat the oven to 450 degrees F and arrange a rack in the middle.
Place a baking sheet upside down in the oven while its heating.
Remove chorizo from its casing and place in a medium frying pan over medium-high heat.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 7 minutes.
Remove to a plate and set aside.
Add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil to the pan.
Add mushrooms and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Cook, stirring rarely, until beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.
Roll out pizza dough to a 10-inch round, remove the hot baking sheet from the oven, drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, and carefully place dough on the upside-down baking sheet.
Scatter chorizo, mushrooms, Jack cheese, and Parmesan cheese on top.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake until cheese is melted and crust is crisp and browned, about 15 minutes.
b067e71075.pred:
preheat oven to 500.
 heat a nonstick grill pan over high heat. cook choriz for 30 seconds or until hot, and then place in a bowl and set aside.
 in the same skillet, heat the olive oil until hot. add the mushrooms and saute for 5 minutes, or until soft. remove from heat.
 roll out the pizza dough. i use a pizza peel. transfer the dough to an ungreased baking sheet. brush the dough lightly with olive oil, then spread the chorisi seasoned grits evenly over the dough. drizzle the mushrooms with olive spray.

Place your jello shot cups on a cookie sheet (that you know will fit in your fridge).

32d7fb7310.gt:
To roast vegetables: Preheat oven to 400.
Wrap peeled garlic cloves together in foil with a few drops of olive oil and put in oven for the same time you will be roasting the peppers and potatoes, around 35 minutes.
Cut potatoes in half and cut red peppers into half inch pieces.
In a large bowl, toss potatoes, bell peppers and 3 TBS olive oil, along with salt and pepper to taste.
Arrange potatoes and bell peppers in one layer, divided amongst 2 shallow baking pans.
Roast in the middle and lower third of the oven, switching positions of the pans halfway through the roasting time, for a total of 35 minutes, or until potatoes are golden brown and tender.
To make salad: After potatoes are done,remove pans from oven and immediately toss roasted potatoes and peppers with 2 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Cool and remove garlic from foil.
Squeeze cloves into a small bowl and mash with a fork with remaining 1/2 TBS olive oil and 1 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Toss together with potatoes and peppers.
Just before serving, add fresh basil.
Serve at room temperature.
Optional items you could add for a main dish meal: goat cheese, toasted pine nuts, grilled chicken, grilled tuna, etc.

6970e8f99b.gt:
Preheat oven to 300F and grease an 8x8 baking pan.
Combine unsweetened chocolate and butter in a medium saucepan and melt over medium low heat, stirring constantly until pieces are almost melted.
Remove from the heat and stir until smooth.
In a large bowl using an electric mixer on medium speed, beat eggs until light yellow in color--about 5 minutes.
Add sugar and blend on low until thoroughly combined.
Add vanilla and melted chocolate to the egg sugar mixture.
Blend on low until smooth.
Add the flour and mix thoroughly.
Pour batter into greased pan.
Smooth surface with a spatula, and sprinkle uniformly with chocolate chips.
Bake on center rack of oven for 45-55 minutes.
The batter should be set and a toothpick inserted into the center should come out clean.
Do not overbake.
Cool to room temperature.
Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour.
Cut and serve chilled.

acfdff90be.gt:
Cut the meat into strips along the grain.
Put the chicken and all the ingredients up to the soy sauce and honey in a bowl and rub in well with your hands.
Leave to marinate for 30 minutes.
After 30 minutes, wipe the excess moisture off the chicken pieces and add 1 tablespoon of cake flour.
That way the batter will stick well to the chicken.
To make the batter: Put the panko in a resealable bag and crush into a fine powder by rolling a rolling pin over the bag.
You can also do this in a food mill or food processor.
Put the crushed panko and the remaining ingredients marked with in a bowl and mix to combine.
Add 250 ml of beer and mix until blended.
The batter should be about the consistency of heavy cream.
If it's too thick add a little more beer, mixing between additions.
Pour cooking oil in a frying pan and heat over medium to about 170C.
Coat each piece of chicken in batter and deep fry.
To avoid the batter from cracking and falling off, turn the pieces over gently after about 30 seconds even if the surface has not hardened.
When the pieces are golden brown, take them out and drain off the oil very well to finish.

e10d62e4d9.gt:
To make the crust, preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Crust cookies in a food processor (or smash in a Ziploc bag with a rolling pin).
Stir in melted butter until all combined.
Pour into a regular pie pan and press crumbs all over the pan and up the sides.
Bake for 3 to 4 minutesjust long enough for it to set.
Cool crust completely.
Place raspberries on a plate or in an empty pan.
Smash them with a fork, then sprinkle on 3 tablespoons of sugar.
Stir together and allow to sit for 15 minutes.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, combine raspberry yogurt with the instant vanilla pudding mix (just the powder itself.)
Beat on low until combined, about 1 minute.
Pour in heavy cream and whip on low for 30 seconds.
Stop the mixer and scrape down the bowl with a rubber spatula.
Turn mixer on medium-high speed and beat for two minutes, or until mixture is thick.
Turn off mixer, then fold in raspberries until just combined.
Pour into cooled pie pan and spread evenly.
Freeze for two hours, or until very firm.
Cut into slices and top each slice with cookie crumbs, dollops of whipped cream, and extra raspberries.
Keep in freezer, allowing time to thaw before serving.

Cookies can be left plain, or decorated with pipped icing.

Mix together the egg, milk, and sugar in a deep bowl or tupperware container.
If you mix up the egg whites to break them up thoroughly, and it'll turn out better.
Cut the frozen bread into 4 pieces.
Use a skewer to poke holes into it.
It's hard for the egg mixture to get absorbed near the crusts, so be sure to poke holes there!
Soak the bread in the egg mixture.
After about two minutes, flip the bread over.
The bread is soft, so if you're worried about breaking it, use a spatula to flip.
Once both sides have completely soaked, fry it up and enjoy!
This is a version made without cutting up the bread.
It might look a bit unappealing with all those holes, but you won't be able to tell at all after it's been fried!
If it's too soft, it can break, but you can use a spatula to safely flip it over.
You can make more french toast with the remaining egg mixture if you like, but I like to pour it over the bread to fill in the holes!
!

To steam the chicken tenders: Arrange the chicken on a plate and sprinkle on the ingredients marked with in order.
Place the rosemary (or other herb) on top, wrap it with plastic wrap and cook it at 700W for 1 minute and 30 seconds.
Turn the chicken over and cook it for another 1 minute.
The cooking time depends on the size of the chicken.
Check the chicken when you turn it over, and adjust the cooking time if necessary.
Leave the chicken, with the plastic on, until they are cool.
Shred the chicken from Step 2 with your hand.
Onions: Thinly slice the onion and soak it in water for about 10 minutes.
Drain in a colander and pat dry with paper towels.
Daikon sprout: Cut in half lengths.
In a bowl, mix the ingredients marked with to make the dressing.
Mix the chicken from Step 3 and onion from Step 4 with the dressing.
Add the daikon sprout and toss them evenly.
Serve it on a plate and garnish with the bonito flakes.
I used Cinzano Dry Vermouth; a blend of white wine with essences of herbs and spices, instead of white wine.
This flavorful drink is good for cooking and drinking.

6a73994e58.gt:
